TFT_eSPI::TFT_eSPI ( int16_t _W = TFT_WIDTH,
int16_t _H = TFT_HEIGHT )

Definición en la línea 439 del archivo TFT_eSPI.cpp.

440{
441 _init_width = _width = w; // Set by specific xxxxx_Defines.h file or by users sketch
442 _init_height = _height = h; // Set by specific xxxxx_Defines.h file or by users sketch
443
444 // Reset the viewport to the whole screen
445 resetViewport();
446
447 rotation = 0;
448 cursor_y = cursor_x = last_cursor_x = bg_cursor_x = 0;
449 textfont = 1;
450 textsize = 1;
451 textcolor = bitmap_fg = 0xFFFF; // White
452 textbgcolor = bitmap_bg = 0x0000; // Black
453 padX = 0; // No padding
454
455 _fillbg = false; // Smooth font only at the moment, force text background fill
456
457 isDigits = false; // No bounding box adjustment
458 textwrapX = true; // Wrap text at end of line when using print stream
459 textwrapY = false; // Wrap text at bottom of screen when using print stream
460 textdatum = TL_DATUM; // Top Left text alignment is default
461 fontsloaded = 0;
462
463 _swapBytes = false; // Do not swap colour bytes by default
464
465 locked = true; // Transaction mutex lock flag to ensure begin/endTranaction pairing
466 inTransaction = false; // Flag to prevent multiple sequential functions to keep bus access open
467 lockTransaction = false; // start/endWrite lock flag to allow sketch to keep SPI bus access open
468
469 _booted = true; // Default attributes
470 _cp437 = false; // Legacy GLCD font bug fix disabled by default
471 _utf8 = true; // UTF8 decoding enabled
472
473#if defined (FONT_FS_AVAILABLE) && defined (SMOOTH_FONT)
474 fs_font = true; // Smooth font filing system or array (fs_font = false) flag
475#endif
476
477#if defined (ESP32) && defined (CONFIG_SPIRAM_SUPPORT)
478 if (psramFound()) _psram_enable = true; // Enable the use of PSRAM (if available)
479 else
480#endif
481 _psram_enable = false;
482
483 addr_row = 0xFFFF; // drawPixel command length optimiser
484 addr_col = 0xFFFF; // drawPixel command length optimiser
485
486 _xPivot = 0;
487 _yPivot = 0;
488
489// Legacy support for bit GPIO masks
490 cspinmask = 0;
491 dcpinmask = 0;
492 wrpinmask = 0;
493 sclkpinmask = 0;
494
495// Flags for which fonts are loaded
496#ifdef LOAD_GLCD
497 fontsloaded = 0x0002; // Bit 1 set
498#endif
499
500#ifdef LOAD_FONT2
501 fontsloaded |= 0x0004; // Bit 2 set
502#endif
503
504#ifdef LOAD_FONT4
505 fontsloaded |= 0x0010; // Bit 4 set
506#endif
507
508#ifdef LOAD_FONT6
509 fontsloaded |= 0x0040; // Bit 6 set
510#endif
511
512#ifdef LOAD_FONT7
513 fontsloaded |= 0x0080; // Bit 7 set
514#endif
515
516#ifdef LOAD_FONT8
517 fontsloaded |= 0x0100; // Bit 8 set
518#endif
519
520#ifdef LOAD_FONT8N
521 fontsloaded |= 0x0200; // Bit 9 set
522#endif
523
524#ifdef SMOOTH_FONT
525 fontsloaded |= 0x8000; // Bit 15 set
526#endif
527}

Documentación de funciones miembro

◆ alphaBlend() [1/2]

uint16_t TFT_eSPI::alphaBlend ( uint8_t alpha,
uint16_t fgc,
uint16_t bgc )

Definición en la línea 4984 del archivo TFT_eSPI.cpp.

4985{
4986 // Split out and blend 5-bit red and blue channels
4987 uint32_t rxb = bgc & 0xF81F;
4988 rxb += ((fgc & 0xF81F) - rxb) * (alpha >> 2) >> 6;
4989 // Split out and blend 6-bit green channel
4990 uint32_t xgx = bgc & 0x07E0;
4991 xgx += ((fgc & 0x07E0) - xgx) * alpha >> 8;
4992 // Recombine channels
4993 return (rxb & 0xF81F) | (xgx & 0x07E0);
4994}

Referenciado por alphaBlend(), drawGlyph() y TFT_eSprite.

◆ alphaBlend() [2/2]

uint16_t TFT_eSPI::alphaBlend ( uint8_t alpha,
uint16_t fgc,
uint16_t bgc,
uint8_t dither )

Definición en la línea 5000 del archivo TFT_eSPI.cpp.

5001{
5002 if (dither) {
5003 int16_t alphaDither = (int16_t)alpha - dither + random(2*dither+1); // +/-4 randomised
5004 alpha = (uint8_t)alphaDither;
5005 if (alphaDither < 0) alpha = 0;
5006 if (alphaDither >255) alpha = 255;
5007 }
5008
5009 return alphaBlend(alpha, fgc, bgc);
5010}
TFT_eSPI::alphaBlend
uint16_t alphaBlend(uint8_t alpha, uint16_t fgc, uint16_t bgc)
Definition TFT_eSPI.cpp:4984

Hace referencia a alphaBlend().

◆ alphaBlend24()

uint32_t TFT_eSPI::alphaBlend24 ( uint8_t alpha,
uint32_t fgc,
uint32_t bgc,
uint8_t dither = 0 )

Definición en la línea 5016 del archivo TFT_eSPI.cpp.

5017{
5018
5019 if (dither) {
5020 int16_t alphaDither = (int16_t)alpha - dither + random(2*dither+1); // +/-dither randomised
5021 alpha = (uint8_t)alphaDither;
5022 if (alphaDither < 0) alpha = 0;
5023 if (alphaDither >255) alpha = 255;
5024 }
5025
5026 uint32_t rxx = bgc & 0xFF0000;
5027 rxx += ((fgc & 0xFF0000) - rxx) * alpha >> 8;
5028 uint32_t xgx = bgc & 0x00FF00;
5029 xgx += ((fgc & 0x00FF00) - xgx) * alpha >> 8;
5030 uint32_t xxb = bgc & 0x0000FF;
5031 xxb += ((fgc & 0x0000FF) - xxb) * alpha >> 8;
5032 return (rxx & 0xFF0000) | (xgx & 0x00FF00) | (xxb & 0x0000FF);
5033}

Referenciado por TFT_eSprite.

◆ calibrateTouch()

void TFT_eSPI::calibrateTouch ( uint16_t * data,
uint32_t color_fg,
uint32_t color_bg,
uint8_t size )

Definición en la línea 228 del archivo Touch.cpp.

228 {
229 int16_t values[] = {0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0};
230 uint16_t x_tmp, y_tmp;
231
232
233
234 for(uint8_t i = 0; i<4; i++){
235 fillRect(0, 0, size+1, size+1, color_bg);
236 fillRect(0, _height-size-1, size+1, size+1, color_bg);
237 fillRect(_width-size-1, 0, size+1, size+1, color_bg);
238 fillRect(_width-size-1, _height-size-1, size+1, size+1, color_bg);
239
240 if (i == 5) break; // used to clear the arrows
241
242 switch (i) {
243 case 0: // up left
244 drawLine(0, 0, 0, size, color_fg);
245 drawLine(0, 0, size, 0, color_fg);
246 drawLine(0, 0, size , size, color_fg);
247 break;
248 case 1: // bot left
249 drawLine(0, _height-size-1, 0, _height-1, color_fg);
250 drawLine(0, _height-1, size, _height-1, color_fg);
251 drawLine(size, _height-size-1, 0, _height-1 , color_fg);
252 break;
253 case 2: // up right
254 drawLine(_width-size-1, 0, _width-1, 0, color_fg);
255 drawLine(_width-size-1, size, _width-1, 0, color_fg);
256 drawLine(_width-1, size, _width-1, 0, color_fg);
257 break;
258 case 3: // bot right
259 drawLine(_width-size-1, _height-size-1, _width-1, _height-1, color_fg);
260 drawLine(_width-1, _height-1-size, _width-1, _height-1, color_fg);
261 drawLine(_width-1-size, _height-1, _width-1, _height-1, color_fg);
262 break;
263 }
264
265 // user has to get the chance to release
266 if(i>0) delay(1000);
267
268 for(uint8_t j= 0; j<8; j++){
269 // Use a lower detect threshold as corners tend to be less sensitive
270 while(!validTouch(&x_tmp, &y_tmp, Z_THRESHOLD/2));
271 values[i*2 ] += x_tmp;
272 values[i*2+1] += y_tmp;
273 }
274 values[i*2 ] /= 8;
275 values[i*2+1] /= 8;
276 }
277
278
279 // from case 0 to case 1, the y value changed.
280 // If the measured delta of the touch x axis is bigger than the delta of the y axis, the touch and TFT axes are switched.
281 touchCalibration_rotate = false;
282 if(abs(values[0]-values[2]) > abs(values[1]-values[3])){
283 touchCalibration_rotate = true;
284 touchCalibration_x0 = (values[1] + values[3])/2; // calc min x
285 touchCalibration_x1 = (values[5] + values[7])/2; // calc max x
286 touchCalibration_y0 = (values[0] + values[4])/2; // calc min y
287 touchCalibration_y1 = (values[2] + values[6])/2; // calc max y
288 } else {
289 touchCalibration_x0 = (values[0] + values[2])/2; // calc min x
290 touchCalibration_x1 = (values[4] + values[6])/2; // calc max x
291 touchCalibration_y0 = (values[1] + values[5])/2; // calc min y
292 touchCalibration_y1 = (values[3] + values[7])/2; // calc max y
293 }
294
295 // in addition, the touch screen axis could be in the opposite direction of the TFT axis
296 touchCalibration_invert_x = false;
297 if(touchCalibration_x0 > touchCalibration_x1){
298 values[0]=touchCalibration_x0;
299 touchCalibration_x0 = touchCalibration_x1;
300 touchCalibration_x1 = values[0];
301 touchCalibration_invert_x = true;
302 }
303 touchCalibration_invert_y = false;
304 if(touchCalibration_y0 > touchCalibration_y1){
305 values[0]=touchCalibration_y0;
306 touchCalibration_y0 = touchCalibration_y1;
307 touchCalibration_y1 = values[0];
308 touchCalibration_invert_y = true;
309 }
310
311 // pre calculate
312 touchCalibration_x1 -= touchCalibration_x0;
313 touchCalibration_y1 -= touchCalibration_y0;
314
315 if(touchCalibration_x0 == 0) touchCalibration_x0 = 1;
316 if(touchCalibration_x1 == 0) touchCalibration_x1 = 1;
317 if(touchCalibration_y0 == 0) touchCalibration_y0 = 1;
318 if(touchCalibration_y1 == 0) touchCalibration_y1 = 1;
319
320 // export parameters, if pointer valid
321 if(parameters != NULL){
322 parameters[0] = touchCalibration_x0;
323 parameters[1] = touchCalibration_x1;
324 parameters[2] = touchCalibration_y0;
325 parameters[3] = touchCalibration_y1;
326 parameters[4] = touchCalibration_rotate | (touchCalibration_invert_x <<1) | (touchCalibration_invert_y <<2);
327 }
328}
delay
delay(120)
Z_THRESHOLD
#define Z_THRESHOLD
Definition Touch.cpp:15

virtual void fillRect(int32_t x, int32_t y, int32_t w, int32_t h, uint32_t color)
Definition TFT_eSPI.cpp:4659

virtual void drawLine(int32_t xs, int32_t ys, int32_t xe, int32_t ye, uint32_t color)
Definition TFT_eSPI.cpp:3884

Hace referencia a _height, _width, delay(), drawLine(), fillRect() y Z_THRESHOLD.

◆ checkViewport()

bool TFT_eSPI::checkViewport ( int32_t x,
int32_t y,
int32_t w,
int32_t h )

Definición en la línea 242 del archivo TFT_eSPI.cpp.

243{
244 if (_vpOoB) return false;
245 x+= _xDatum;
246 y+= _yDatum;
247
248 if ((x >= _vpW) || (y >= _vpH)) return false;
249
250 int32_t dx = 0;
251 int32_t dy = 0;
252 int32_t dw = w;
253 int32_t dh = h;
254
255 if (x < _vpX) { dx = _vpX - x; dw -= dx; x = _vpX; }
256 if (y < _vpY) { dy = _vpY - y; dh -= dy; y = _vpY; }
257
258 if ((x + dw) > _vpW ) dw = _vpW - x;
259 if ((y + dh) > _vpH ) dh = _vpH - y;
260
261 if (dw < 1 || dh < 1) return false;
262
263 return true;
264}

◆ clipAddrWindow()

bool TFT_eSPI::clipAddrWindow ( int32_t * x,
int32_t * y,
int32_t * w,
int32_t * h )

Definición en la línea 388 del archivo TFT_eSPI.cpp.

389{
390 if (_vpOoB) return false; // Area is outside of viewport
391
392 *x+= _xDatum;
393 *y+= _yDatum;
394
395 if ((*x >= _vpW) || (*y >= _vpH)) return false; // Area is outside of viewport
396
397 // Crop drawing area bounds
398 if (*x < _vpX) { *w -= _vpX - *x; *x = _vpX; }
399 if (*y < _vpY) { *h -= _vpY - *y; *y = _vpY; }
400
401 if ((*x + *w) > _vpW ) *w = _vpW - *x;
402 if ((*y + *h) > _vpH ) *h = _vpH - *y;
403
404 if (*w < 1 || *h < 1) return false; // No area is inside viewport
405
406 return true; // Area is wholly or partially inside viewport
407}

Hace referencia a _vpH, _vpOoB, _vpW, _vpX, _vpY, _xDatum y _yDatum.

416

418 *ys+= _yDatum;
419 *xe+= _xDatum;

◆ color16to24()

uint32_t TFT_eSPI::color16to24 ( uint16_t color565)

4814{
4815 uint8_t r = (color565 >> 8) & 0xF8; r |= (r >> 5);
4816 uint8_t g = (color565 >> 3) & 0xFC; g |= (g >> 6);
4817 uint8_t b = (color565 << 3) & 0xF8; b |= (b >> 5);
4818
4819 return ((uint32_t)r << 16) | ((uint32_t)g << 8) | ((uint32_t)b << 0);
4820}

◆ color8to16()

uint16_t TFT_eSPI::color8to16 ( uint8_t color332)

Definición en la línea 4796 del archivo TFT_eSPI.cpp.

4797{
4798 uint8_t blue[] = {0, 11, 21, 31}; // blue 2 to 5-bit colour lookup table
4799 uint16_t color16 = 0;
4800
4801 // =====Green===== ===============Red==============
4802 color16 = (color & 0x1C)<<6 | (color & 0xC0)<<5 | (color & 0xE0)<<8;
4803 // =====Green===== =======Blue======
4804 color16 |= (color & 0x1C)<<3 | blue[color & 0x03];
4805
4806 return color16;
4807}

◆ commandList()

void TFT_eSPI::commandList ( const uint8_t * addr)

Definición en la línea 933 del archivo TFT_eSPI.cpp.

934{
935 uint8_t numCommands;
936 uint8_t numArgs;
937 uint8_t ms;
938
939 numCommands = pgm_read_byte(addr++); // Number of commands to follow
940
941 while (numCommands--) // For each command...
942 {
943 writecommand(pgm_read_byte(addr++)); // Read, issue command
944 numArgs = pgm_read_byte(addr++); // Number of args to follow
945 ms = numArgs & TFT_INIT_DELAY; // If high bit set, delay follows args
946 numArgs &= ~TFT_INIT_DELAY; // Mask out delay bit
947
948 while (numArgs--) // For each argument...
949 {
950 writedata(pgm_read_byte(addr++)); // Read, issue argument
951 }
952
953 if (ms)
954 {
955 ms = pgm_read_byte(addr++); // Read post-command delay time (ms)
956 delay( (ms==255 ? 500 : ms) );
957 }
958 }
959
960}

204
205 if(!touchCalibration_rotate){
206 xx=(x_tmp-touchCalibration_x0)*_width/touchCalibration_x1;
207 yy=(y_tmp-touchCalibration_y0)*_height/touchCalibration_y1;
208 if(touchCalibration_invert_x)

◆ decodeUTF8() [1/2]

uint16_t TFT_eSPI::decodeUTF8 ( uint8_t * buf,
uint16_t * index,
uint16_t remaining )

Definición en la línea 4950 del archivo TFT_eSPI.cpp.

4951{
4952 uint16_t c = buf[(*index)++];
4953 //Serial.print("Byte from string = 0x"); Serial.println(c, HEX);
4954
4955 if (!_utf8) return c;
4956
4957 // 7-bit Unicode
4958 if ((c & 0x80) == 0x00) return c;
4959
4960 // 11-bit Unicode
4961 if (((c & 0xE0) == 0xC0) && (remaining > 1))
4962 return ((c & 0x1F)<<6) | (buf[(*index)++]&0x3F);
4963
4964 // 16-bit Unicode
4965 if (((c & 0xF0) == 0xE0) && (remaining > 2)) {
4966 c = ((c & 0x0F)<<12) | ((buf[(*index)++]&0x3F)<<6);
4967 return c | ((buf[(*index)++]&0x3F));
4968 }
4969
4970 // 21-bit Unicode not supported so fall-back to extended ASCII
4971 // if (((c & 0xF8) == 0xF0) && (remaining > 3)) {
4972 // c = ((c & 0x07) << 18) | ((buf[(*index)++] & 0x03F) << 12);
4973 // c |= ((buf[(*index)++] & 0x3F) << 6);
4974 // return c | ((buf[(*index)++] & 0x3F));
4975
4976 return c; // fall-back to extended ASCII
4977}

Hace referencia a _utf8.

Referenciado por drawString(), textWidth(), TFT_eSprite y write().

◆ decodeUTF8() [2/2]

uint16_t TFT_eSPI::decodeUTF8 ( uint8_t c)

Definición en la línea 4901 del archivo TFT_eSPI.cpp.

4902{
4903 if (!_utf8) return c;
4904
4905 // 7-bit Unicode Code Point
4906 if ((c & 0x80) == 0x00) {
4907 decoderState = 0;
4908 return c;
4909 }
4910
4911 if (decoderState == 0) {
4912 // 11-bit Unicode Code Point
4913 if ((c & 0xE0) == 0xC0) {
4914 decoderBuffer = ((c & 0x1F)<<6);
4915 decoderState = 1;
4916 return 0;
4917 }
4918 // 16-bit Unicode Code Point
4919 if ((c & 0xF0) == 0xE0) {
4920 decoderBuffer = ((c & 0x0F)<<12);
4921 decoderState = 2;
4922 return 0;
4923 }
4924 // 21-bit Unicode Code Point not supported so fall-back to extended ASCII
4925 // if ((c & 0xF8) == 0xF0) return c;
4926 }
4927 else {
4928 if (decoderState == 2) {
4929 decoderBuffer |= ((c & 0x3F)<<6);
4930 decoderState--;
4931 return 0;
4932 }
4933 else {
4934 decoderBuffer |= (c & 0x3F);
4935 decoderState = 0;
4936 return decoderBuffer;
4937 }
4938 }
4939
4940 decoderState = 0;
4941
4942 return c; // fall-back to extended ASCII
4943}
TFT_eSPI::decoderState
uint8_t decoderState
Definition TFT_eSPI.h:835
TFT_eSPI::decoderBuffer
uint16_t decoderBuffer
Definition TFT_eSPI.h:836

Hace referencia a _utf8, decoderBuffer y decoderState.

◆ drawArc()

void TFT_eSPI::drawArc ( int32_t x,
int32_t y,
int32_t r,
int32_t ir,
uint32_t startAngle,
uint32_t endAngle,
uint32_t fg_color,
uint32_t bg_color,
bool smoothArc = true )

Definición en la línea 4066 del archivo TFT_eSPI.cpp.

4070{
4071 if (endAngle > 360) endAngle = 360;
4072 if (startAngle > 360) startAngle = 360;
4073 if (_vpOoB || startAngle == endAngle) return;
4074 if (r < ir) transpose(r, ir); // Required that r > ir
4075 if (r <= 0 || ir < 0) return; // Invalid r, ir can be zero (circle sector)
4076
4077 if (endAngle < startAngle) {
4078 // Arc sweeps through 6 o'clock so draw in two parts
4079 if (startAngle < 360) drawArc(x, y, r, ir, startAngle, 360, fg_color, bg_color, smooth);
4080 if (endAngle == 0) return;
4081 startAngle = 0;
4082 }
4083 inTransaction = true;
4084
4085 int32_t xs = 0; // x start position for quadrant scan
4086 uint8_t alpha = 0; // alpha value for blending pixels
4087
4088 uint32_t r2 = r * r; // Outer arc radius^2
4089 if (smooth) r++; // Outer AA zone radius
4090 uint32_t r1 = r * r; // Outer AA radius^2
4091 int16_t w = r - ir; // Width of arc (r - ir + 1)
4092 uint32_t r3 = ir * ir; // Inner arc radius^2
4093 if (smooth) ir--; // Inner AA zone radius
4094 uint32_t r4 = ir * ir; // Inner AA radius^2
4095
4096 // 1 | 2
4097 // ---¦--- Arc quadrant index
4098 // 0 | 3
4099 // Fixed point U16.16 slope table for arc start/end in each quadrant
4100 uint32_t startSlope[4] = {0, 0, 0xFFFFFFFF, 0};
4101 uint32_t endSlope[4] = {0, 0xFFFFFFFF, 0, 0};
4102
4103 // Ensure maximum U16.16 slope of arc ends is ~ 0x8000 0000
4104 constexpr float minDivisor = 1.0f/0x8000;
4105
4106 // Fill in start slope table and empty quadrants
4107 float fabscos = fabsf(cosf(startAngle * deg2rad));
4108 float fabssin = fabsf(sinf(startAngle * deg2rad));
4109
4110 // U16.16 slope of arc start
4111 uint32_t slope = (fabscos/(fabssin + minDivisor)) * (float)(1UL<<16);
4112
4113 // Update slope table, add slope for arc start
4114 if (startAngle <= 90) {
4115 startSlope[0] = slope;
4116 }
4117 else if (startAngle <= 180) {
4118 startSlope[1] = slope;
4119 }
4120 else if (startAngle <= 270) {
4121 startSlope[1] = 0xFFFFFFFF;
4122 startSlope[2] = slope;
4123 }
4124 else {
4125 startSlope[1] = 0xFFFFFFFF;
4126 startSlope[2] = 0;
4127 startSlope[3] = slope;
4128 }
4129
4130 // Fill in end slope table and empty quadrants
4131 fabscos = fabsf(cosf(endAngle * deg2rad));
4132 fabssin = fabsf(sinf(endAngle * deg2rad));
4133
4134 // U16.16 slope of arc end
4135 slope = (uint32_t)((fabscos/(fabssin + minDivisor)) * (float)(1UL<<16));
4136
4137 // Work out which quadrants will need to be drawn and add slope for arc end
4138 if (endAngle <= 90) {
4139 endSlope[0] = slope;
4140 endSlope[1] = 0;
4141 startSlope[2] = 0;
4142 }
4143 else if (endAngle <= 180) {
4144 endSlope[1] = slope;
4145 startSlope[2] = 0;
4146 }
4147 else if (endAngle <= 270) {
4148 endSlope[2] = slope;
4149 }
4150 else {
4151 endSlope[3] = slope;
4152 }
4153
4154 // Scan quadrant
4155 for (int32_t cy = r - 1; cy > 0; cy--)
4156 {
4157 uint32_t len[4] = { 0, 0, 0, 0}; // Pixel run length
4158 int32_t xst[4] = {-1, -1, -1, -1}; // Pixel run x start
4159 uint32_t dy2 = (r - cy) * (r - cy);
4160
4161 // Find and track arc zone start point
4162 while ((r - xs) * (r - xs) + dy2 >= r1) xs++;
4163
4164 for (int32_t cx = xs; cx < r; cx++)
4165 {
4166 // Calculate radius^2
4167 uint32_t hyp = (r - cx) * (r - cx) + dy2;
4168
4169 // If in outer zone calculate alpha
4170 if (hyp > r2) {
4171 alpha = ~sqrt_fraction(hyp); // Outer AA zone
4172 }
4173 // If within arc fill zone, get line start and lengths for each quadrant
4174 else if (hyp >= r3) {
4175 // Calculate U16.16 slope
4176 slope = ((r - cy) << 16)/(r - cx);
4177 if (slope <= startSlope[0] && slope >= endSlope[0]) { // slope hi -> lo
4178 xst[0] = cx; // Bottom left line end
4179 len[0]++;
4180 }
4181 if (slope >= startSlope[1] && slope <= endSlope[1]) { // slope lo -> hi
4182 xst[1] = cx; // Top left line end
4183 len[1]++;
4184 }
4185 if (slope <= startSlope[2] && slope >= endSlope[2]) { // slope hi -> lo
4186 xst[2] = cx; // Bottom right line start
4187 len[2]++;
4188 }
4189 if (slope <= endSlope[3] && slope >= startSlope[3]) { // slope lo -> hi
4190 xst[3] = cx; // Top right line start
4191 len[3]++;
4192 }
4193 continue; // Next x
4194 }
4195 else {
4196 if (hyp <= r4) break; // Skip inner pixels
4197 alpha = sqrt_fraction(hyp); // Inner AA zone
4198 }
4199
4200 if (alpha < 16) continue; // Skip low alpha pixels
4201
4202 // If background is read it must be done in each quadrant
4203 uint16_t pcol = fastBlend(alpha, fg_color, bg_color);
4204 // Check if an AA pixels need to be drawn
4205 slope = ((r - cy)<<16)/(r - cx);
4206 if (slope <= startSlope[0] && slope >= endSlope[0]) // BL
4207 drawPixel(x + cx - r, y - cy + r, pcol);
4208 if (slope >= startSlope[1] && slope <= endSlope[1]) // TL
4209 drawPixel(x + cx - r, y + cy - r, pcol);
4210 if (slope <= startSlope[2] && slope >= endSlope[2]) // TR
4211 drawPixel(x - cx + r, y + cy - r, pcol);
4212 if (slope <= endSlope[3] && slope >= startSlope[3]) // BR
4213 drawPixel(x - cx + r, y - cy + r, pcol);
4214 }
4215 // Add line in inner zone
4216 if (len[0]) drawFastHLine(x + xst[0] - len[0] + 1 - r, y - cy + r, len[0], fg_color); // BL
4217 if (len[1]) drawFastHLine(x + xst[1] - len[1] + 1 - r, y + cy - r, len[1], fg_color); // TL
4218 if (len[2]) drawFastHLine(x - xst[2] + r, y + cy - r, len[2], fg_color); // TR
4219 if (len[3]) drawFastHLine(x - xst[3] + r, y - cy + r, len[3], fg_color); // BR
4220 }
4221
4222 // Fill in centre lines
4223 if (startAngle == 0 || endAngle == 360) drawFastVLine(x, y + r - w, w, fg_color); // Bottom
4224 if (startAngle <= 90 && endAngle >= 90) drawFastHLine(x - r + 1, y, w, fg_color); // Left
4225 if (startAngle <= 180 && endAngle >= 180) drawFastVLine(x, y - r + 1, w, fg_color); // Top
4226 if (startAngle <= 270 && endAngle >= 270) drawFastHLine(x + r - w, y, w, fg_color); // Right
4227
4228 inTransaction = lockTransaction;
4229 end_tft_write();
4230}
end_tft_write
end_tft_write()
deg2rad
constexpr float deg2rad
Definition TFT_eSPI.cpp:3953
TFT_eSPI::drawFastHLine
virtual void drawFastHLine(int32_t x, int32_t y, int32_t w, uint32_t color)
Definition TFT_eSPI.cpp:4629
TFT_eSPI::drawArc
void drawArc(int32_t x, int32_t y, int32_t r, int32_t ir, uint32_t startAngle, uint32_t endAngle, uint32_t fg_color, uint32_t bg_color, bool smoothArc=true)
Definition TFT_eSPI.cpp:4066
TFT_eSPI::drawPixel
virtual void drawPixel(int32_t x, int32_t y, uint32_t color)
Definition TFT_eSPI.cpp:3582
TFT_eSPI::drawFastVLine
virtual void drawFastVLine(int32_t x, int32_t y, int32_t h, uint32_t color)
Definition TFT_eSPI.cpp:4599

Hace referencia a _vpOoB, deg2rad, drawArc(), drawFastHLine(), drawFastVLine(), drawPixel() y end_tft_write().

Referenciado por drawArc(), drawSmoothArc() y TFT_eSprite.

2764 //begin_tft_write(); // Sprite class can use this function, avoiding begin_tft_write()
2765 inTransaction = true;
2766
2767 int32_t i, j, byteWidth = (w + 7) / 8;
2768

2770 for (i = 0; i < w; i++ ) {
2771 if (pgm_read_byte(bitmap + j * byteWidth + i / 8) & (128 >> (i & 7))) {
2772 drawPixel(x + i, y + j, color);
2773 }
2774 }
2775 }

◆ drawChar() [1/3]

void TFT_eSPI::drawChar ( int32_t x,
int32_t y,
uint16_t c,
uint32_t color,
uint32_t bg,
uint8_t size )

Definición en la línea 3183 del archivo TFT_eSPI.cpp.

3184{
3185 if (_vpOoB) return;
3186
3187#ifdef LOAD_GLCD
3188//>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
3189 #ifdef LOAD_GFXFF
3190 if(!gfxFont) { // 'Classic' built-in GLCD font
3191 #endif
3192//>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
3193
3194 int32_t xd = x + _xDatum;
3195 int32_t yd = y + _yDatum;
3196
3197 if ((xd >= _vpW) || // Clip right
3198 ( yd >= _vpH) || // Clip bottom
3199 ((xd + 6 * size - 1) < _vpX) || // Clip left
3200 ((yd + 8 * size - 1) < _vpY)) // Clip top
3201 return;
3202
3203 if (c > 255) return;
3204 if (!_cp437 && c > 175) c++;
3205
3206 bool fillbg = (bg != color);
3207 bool clip = xd < _vpX || xd + 6 * textsize >= _vpW || yd < _vpY || yd + 8 * textsize >= _vpH;
3208
3209 if ((size==1) && fillbg && !clip) {
3210 uint8_t column[6];
3211 uint8_t mask = 0x1;
3212 begin_tft_write();
3213
3214 setWindow(xd, yd, xd+5, yd+7);
3215
3216 for (int8_t i = 0; i < 5; i++ ) column[i] = pgm_read_byte(&font[0] + (c * 5) + i);
3217 column[5] = 0;
3218
3219 for (int8_t j = 0; j < 8; j++) {
3220 for (int8_t k = 0; k < 5; k++ ) {
3221 if (column[k] & mask) {tft_Write_16(color);}
3222 else {tft_Write_16(bg);}
3223 }
3224 mask <<= 1;
3225 tft_Write_16(bg);
3226 }
3227
3228 end_tft_write();
3229 }
3230 else {
3231 //begin_tft_write(); // Sprite class can use this function, avoiding begin_tft_write()
3232 inTransaction = true;
3233
3234 for (int8_t i = 0; i < 6; i++ ) {
3235 uint8_t line;
3236 if (i == 5)
3237 line = 0x0;
3238 else
3239 line = pgm_read_byte(&font[0] + (c * 5) + i);
3240
3241 if (size == 1 && !fillbg) { // default size
3242 for (int8_t j = 0; j < 8; j++) {
3243 if (line & 0x1) drawPixel(x + i, y + j, color);
3244 line >>= 1;
3245 }
3246 }
3247 else { // big size or clipped
3248 for (int8_t j = 0; j < 8; j++) {
3249 if (line & 0x1) fillRect(x + (i * size), y + (j * size), size, size, color);
3250 else if (fillbg) fillRect(x + i * size, y + j * size, size, size, bg);
3251 line >>= 1;
3252 }
3253 }
3254 }
3255 inTransaction = lockTransaction;
3256 end_tft_write(); // Does nothing if Sprite class uses this function
3257 }
3258
3259//>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
3260 #ifdef LOAD_GFXFF
3261 } else { // Custom font
3262 #endif
3263//>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
3264#endif // LOAD_GLCD
3265
3266#ifdef LOAD_GFXFF
3267 // Filter out bad characters not present in font
3268 if ((c >= pgm_read_word(&gfxFont->first)) && (c <= pgm_read_word(&gfxFont->last ))) {
3269 //begin_tft_write(); // Sprite class can use this function, avoiding begin_tft_write()
3270 inTransaction = true;
3271//>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
3272
3273 c -= pgm_read_word(&gfxFont->first);
3274 GFXglyph *glyph = &(((GFXglyph *)pgm_read_dword(&gfxFont->glyph))[c]);
3275 uint8_t *bitmap = (uint8_t *)pgm_read_dword(&gfxFont->bitmap);
3276
3277 uint32_t bo = pgm_read_word(&glyph->bitmapOffset);
3278 uint8_t w = pgm_read_byte(&glyph->width),
3279 h = pgm_read_byte(&glyph->height);
3280 //xa = pgm_read_byte(&glyph->xAdvance);
3281 int8_t xo = pgm_read_byte(&glyph->xOffset),
3282 yo = pgm_read_byte(&glyph->yOffset);
3283 uint8_t xx, yy, bits=0, bit=0;
3284 int16_t xo16 = 0, yo16 = 0;
3285
3286 if(size > 1) {
3287 xo16 = xo;
3288 yo16 = yo;
3289 }
3290
3291 // GFXFF rendering speed up
3292 uint16_t hpc = 0; // Horizontal foreground pixel count
3293 for(yy=0; yy<h; yy++) {
3294 for(xx=0; xx<w; xx++) {
3295 if(bit == 0) {
3296 bits = pgm_read_byte(&bitmap[bo++]);
3297 bit = 0x80;
3298 }
3299 if(bits & bit) hpc++;
3300 else {
3301 if (hpc) {
3302 if(size == 1) drawFastHLine(x+xo+xx-hpc, y+yo+yy, hpc, color);
3303 else fillRect(x+(xo16+xx-hpc)*size, y+(yo16+yy)*size, size*hpc, size, color);
3304 hpc=0;
3305 }
3306 }
3307 bit >>= 1;
3308 }
3309 // Draw pixels for this line as we are about to increment yy
3310 if (hpc) {
3311 if(size == 1) drawFastHLine(x+xo+xx-hpc, y+yo+yy, hpc, color);
3312 else fillRect(x+(xo16+xx-hpc)*size, y+(yo16+yy)*size, size*hpc, size, color);
3313 hpc=0;
3314 }
3315 }
3316
3317 inTransaction = lockTransaction;
3318 end_tft_write(); // Does nothing if Sprite class uses this function
3319 }
3320#endif
3321
3322#ifdef LOAD_GLCD
3323 #ifdef LOAD_GFXFF
3324 } // End classic vs custom font
3325 #endif
3326#else
3327 #ifndef LOAD_GFXFF
3328 // Avoid warnings if fonts are disabled
3329 x = x;
3330 y = y;
3331 color = color;
3332 bg = bg;
3333 size = size;
3334 #endif
3335#endif
3336
3337}

◆ drawChar() [3/3]

int16_t TFT_eSPI::drawChar ( uint16_t uniCode,
int32_t x,
int32_t y,
uint8_t font )
virtual

Reimplementado en TFT_eSprite.

Definición en la línea 5192 del archivo TFT_eSPI.cpp.

5193{
5194 if (_vpOoB || !uniCode) return 0;
5195
5196 if (font==1) {
5197#ifdef LOAD_GLCD
5198 #ifndef LOAD_GFXFF
5199 drawChar(x, y, uniCode, textcolor, textbgcolor, textsize);
5200 return 6 * textsize;
5201 #endif
5202#else
5203 #ifndef LOAD_GFXFF
5204 return 0;
5205 #endif
5206#endif
5207
5208#ifdef LOAD_GFXFF
5209 drawChar(x, y, uniCode, textcolor, textbgcolor, textsize);
5210 if(!gfxFont) { // 'Classic' built-in font
5211 #ifdef LOAD_GLCD
5212 return 6 * textsize;
5213 #else
5214 return 0;
5215 #endif
5216 }
5217 else {
5218 if((uniCode >= pgm_read_word(&gfxFont->first)) && (uniCode <= pgm_read_word(&gfxFont->last) )) {
5219 uint16_t c2 = uniCode - pgm_read_word(&gfxFont->first);
5220 GFXglyph *glyph = &(((GFXglyph *)pgm_read_dword(&gfxFont->glyph))[c2]);
5221 return pgm_read_byte(&glyph->xAdvance) * textsize;
5222 }
5223 else {
5224 return 0;
5225 }
5226 }
5227#endif
5228 }
5229
5230 if ((font>1) && (font<9) && ((uniCode < 32) || (uniCode > 127))) return 0;
5231
5232 int32_t width = 0;
5233 int32_t height = 0;
5234 uint32_t flash_address = 0;
5235 uniCode -= 32;
5236
5237#ifdef LOAD_FONT2
5238 if (font == 2) {
5239 flash_address = pgm_read_dword(&chrtbl_f16[uniCode]);
5240 width = pgm_read_byte(widtbl_f16 + uniCode);
5241 height = chr_hgt_f16;
5242 }
5243 #ifdef LOAD_RLE
5244 else
5245 #endif
5246#endif
5247
5248#ifdef LOAD_RLE
5249 {
5250 if ((font>2) && (font<9)) {
5251 flash_address = pgm_read_dword( (const void*)(pgm_read_dword( &(fontdata[font].chartbl ) ) + uniCode*sizeof(void *)) );
5252 width = pgm_read_byte( (uint8_t *)pgm_read_dword( &(fontdata[font].widthtbl ) ) + uniCode );
5253 height= pgm_read_byte( &fontdata[font].height );
5254 }
5255 }
5256#endif
5257
5258 int32_t xd = x + _xDatum;
5259 int32_t yd = y + _yDatum;
5260
5261 if ((xd + width * textsize < _vpX || xd >= _vpW) && (yd + height * textsize < _vpY || yd >= _vpH)) return width * textsize ;
5262
5263 int32_t w = width;
5264 int32_t pX = 0;
5265 int32_t pY = y;
5266 uint8_t line = 0;
5267 bool clip = xd < _vpX || xd + width * textsize >= _vpW || yd < _vpY || yd + height * textsize >= _vpH;
5268
5269#ifdef LOAD_FONT2 // chop out code if we do not need it
5270 if (font == 2) {
5271 w = w + 6; // Should be + 7 but we need to compensate for width increment
5272 w = w / 8;
5273
5274 if (textcolor == textbgcolor || textsize != 1 || clip) {
5275 //begin_tft_write(); // Sprite class can use this function, avoiding begin_tft_write()
5276 inTransaction = true;
5277
5278 for (int32_t i = 0; i < height; i++) {
5279 if (textcolor != textbgcolor) fillRect(x, pY, width * textsize, textsize, textbgcolor);
5280
5281 for (int32_t k = 0; k < w; k++) {
5282 line = pgm_read_byte((uint8_t *)flash_address + w * i + k);
5283 if (line) {
5284 if (textsize == 1) {
5285 pX = x + k * 8;
5286 if (line & 0x80) drawPixel(pX, pY, textcolor);
5287 if (line & 0x40) drawPixel(pX + 1, pY, textcolor);
5288 if (line & 0x20) drawPixel(pX + 2, pY, textcolor);
5289 if (line & 0x10) drawPixel(pX + 3, pY, textcolor);
5290 if (line & 0x08) drawPixel(pX + 4, pY, textcolor);
5291 if (line & 0x04) drawPixel(pX + 5, pY, textcolor);
5292 if (line & 0x02) drawPixel(pX + 6, pY, textcolor);
5293 if (line & 0x01) drawPixel(pX + 7, pY, textcolor);
5294 }
5295 else {
5296 pX = x + k * 8 * textsize;
5297 if (line & 0x80) fillRect(pX, pY, textsize, textsize, textcolor);
5298 if (line & 0x40) fillRect(pX + textsize, pY, textsize, textsize, textcolor);
5299 if (line & 0x20) fillRect(pX + 2 * textsize, pY, textsize, textsize, textcolor);
5300 if (line & 0x10) fillRect(pX + 3 * textsize, pY, textsize, textsize, textcolor);
5301 if (line & 0x08) fillRect(pX + 4 * textsize, pY, textsize, textsize, textcolor);
5302 if (line & 0x04) fillRect(pX + 5 * textsize, pY, textsize, textsize, textcolor);
5303 if (line & 0x02) fillRect(pX + 6 * textsize, pY, textsize, textsize, textcolor);
5304 if (line & 0x01) fillRect(pX + 7 * textsize, pY, textsize, textsize, textcolor);
5305 }
5306 }
5307 }
5308 pY += textsize;
5309 }
5310
5311 inTransaction = lockTransaction;
5312 end_tft_write();
5313 }
5314 else { // Faster drawing of characters and background using block write
5315
5316 begin_tft_write();
5317
5318 setWindow(xd, yd, xd + width - 1, yd + height - 1);
5319
5320 uint8_t mask;
5321 for (int32_t i = 0; i < height; i++) {
5322 pX = width;
5323 for (int32_t k = 0; k < w; k++) {
5324 line = pgm_read_byte((uint8_t *) (flash_address + w * i + k) );
5325 mask = 0x80;
5326 while (mask && pX) {
5327 if (line & mask) {tft_Write_16(textcolor);}
5328 else {tft_Write_16(textbgcolor);}
5329 pX--;
5330 mask = mask >> 1;
5331 }
5332 }
5333 if (pX) {tft_Write_16(textbgcolor);}
5334 }
5335
5336 end_tft_write();
5337 }
5338 }
5339
5340 #ifdef LOAD_RLE
5341 else
5342 #endif
5343#endif //FONT2
5344
5345#ifdef LOAD_RLE //674 bytes of code
5346 // Font is not 2 and hence is RLE encoded
5347 {
5348 begin_tft_write();
5349 inTransaction = true;
5350
5351 w *= height; // Now w is total number of pixels in the character
5352 if (textcolor == textbgcolor && !clip) {
5353
5354 int32_t px = 0, py = pY; // To hold character block start and end column and row values
5355 int32_t pc = 0; // Pixel count
5356 uint8_t np = textsize * textsize; // Number of pixels in a drawn pixel
5357
5358 uint8_t tnp = 0; // Temporary copy of np for while loop
5359 uint8_t ts = textsize - 1; // Temporary copy of textsize
5360 // 16-bit pixel count so maximum font size is equivalent to 180x180 pixels in area
5361 // w is total number of pixels to plot to fill character block
5362 while (pc < w) {
5363 line = pgm_read_byte((uint8_t *)flash_address);
5364 flash_address++;
5365 if (line & 0x80) {
5366 line &= 0x7F;
5367 line++;
5368 if (ts) {
5369 px = xd + textsize * (pc % width); // Keep these px and py calculations outside the loop as they are slow
5370 py = yd + textsize * (pc / width);
5371 }
5372 else {
5373 px = xd + pc % width; // Keep these px and py calculations outside the loop as they are slow
5374 py = yd + pc / width;
5375 }
5376 while (line--) { // In this case the while(line--) is faster
5377 pc++; // This is faster than putting pc+=line before while()?
5378 setWindow(px, py, px + ts, py + ts);
5379
5380 if (ts) {
5381 tnp = np;
5382 while (tnp--) {tft_Write_16(textcolor);}
5383 }
5384 else {tft_Write_16(textcolor);}
5385 px += textsize;
5386
5387 if (px >= (xd + width * textsize)) {
5388 px = xd;
5389 py += textsize;
5390 }
5391 }
5392 }
5393 else {
5394 line++;
5395 pc += line;
5396 }
5397 }
5398 }
5399 else {
5400 // Text colour != background and textsize = 1 and character is within viewport area
5401 // so use faster drawing of characters and background using block write
5402 if (textcolor != textbgcolor && textsize == 1 && !clip)
5403 {
5404 setWindow(xd, yd, xd + width - 1, yd + height - 1);
5405
5406 // Maximum font size is equivalent to 180x180 pixels in area
5407 while (w > 0) {
5408 line = pgm_read_byte((uint8_t *)flash_address++); // 8 bytes smaller when incrementing here
5409 if (line & 0x80) {
5410 line &= 0x7F;
5411 line++; w -= line;
5412 pushBlock(textcolor,line);
5413 }
5414 else {
5415 line++; w -= line;
5416 pushBlock(textbgcolor,line);
5417 }
5418 }
5419 }
5420 else
5421 {
5422 int32_t px = 0, py = 0; // To hold character pixel coords
5423 int32_t tx = 0, ty = 0; // To hold character TFT pixel coords
5424 int32_t pc = 0; // Pixel count
5425 int32_t pl = 0; // Pixel line length
5426 uint16_t pcol = 0; // Pixel color
5427 bool pf = true; // Flag for plotting
5428 while (pc < w) {
5429 line = pgm_read_byte((uint8_t *)flash_address);
5430 flash_address++;
5431 if (line & 0x80) { pcol = textcolor; line &= 0x7F; pf = true;}
5432 else { pcol = textbgcolor; if (textcolor == textbgcolor) pf = false;}
5433 line++;
5434 px = pc % width;
5435 tx = x + textsize * px;
5436 py = pc / width;
5437 ty = y + textsize * py;
5438
5439 pl = 0;
5440 pc += line;
5441 while (line--) {
5442 pl++;
5443 if ((px+pl) >= width) {
5444 if (pf) fillRect(tx, ty, pl * textsize, textsize, pcol);
5445 pl = 0;
5446 px = 0;
5447 tx = x;
5448 py ++;
5449 ty += textsize;
5450 }
5451 }
5452 if (pl && pf) fillRect(tx, ty, pl * textsize, textsize, pcol);
5453 }
5454 }
5455 }
5456 inTransaction = lockTransaction;
5457 end_tft_write();
5458 }
5459 // End of RLE font rendering
5460#endif
5461
5462#if !defined (LOAD_FONT2) && !defined (LOAD_RLE)
5463 // Stop warnings
5464 flash_address = flash_address;
5465 w = w;
5466 pX = pX;
5467 pY = pY;
5468 line = line;
5469 clip = clip;
5470#endif
5471
5472 return width * textsize; // x +
5473}
chrtbl_f16
PROGMEM const unsigned char *const chrtbl_f16[96]
Definition Font16.c:618
widtbl_f16
PROGMEM const unsigned char widtbl_f16[96]
Definition Font16.c:13
chr_hgt_f16
#define chr_hgt_f16
Definition Font16.h:4
fontdata
const PROGMEM fontinfo fontdata[]
Definition TFT_eSPI.h:235
TFT_eSPI::height
virtual int16_t height(void)
Definition TFT_eSPI.cpp:3041
TFT_eSPI::pushBlock
void pushBlock(uint16_t color, uint32_t len)
Definition TFT_eSPI_ESP32.c:255
TFT_eSPI::width
virtual int16_t width(void)
Definition TFT_eSPI.cpp:3030

void TFT_eSPI::drawCircle ( int32_t x,

Definición en la línea 2275 del archivo TFT_eSPI.cpp.

2276{
2277 if ( r <= 0 ) return;
2278
2279 //begin_tft_write(); // Sprite class can use this function, avoiding begin_tft_write()
2280 inTransaction = true;
2281
2282 int32_t f = 1 - r;
2283 int32_t ddF_y = -2 * r;
2284 int32_t ddF_x = 1;
2285 int32_t xs = -1;
2286 int32_t xe = 0;
2287 int32_t len = 0;
2288
2289 bool first = true;
2290 do {
2291 while (f < 0) {
2292 ++xe;
2293 f += (ddF_x += 2);
2294 }
2295 f += (ddF_y += 2);
2296
2297 if (xe-xs>1) {
2298 if (first) {
2299 len = 2*(xe - xs)-1;
2300 drawFastHLine(x0 - xe, y0 + r, len, color);
2301 drawFastHLine(x0 - xe, y0 - r, len, color);
2302 drawFastVLine(x0 + r, y0 - xe, len, color);
2303 drawFastVLine(x0 - r, y0 - xe, len, color);
2304 first = false;
2305 }
2306 else {
2307 len = xe - xs++;
2308 drawFastHLine(x0 - xe, y0 + r, len, color);
2309 drawFastHLine(x0 - xe, y0 - r, len, color);
2310 drawFastHLine(x0 + xs, y0 - r, len, color);
2311 drawFastHLine(x0 + xs, y0 + r, len, color);
2312
2313 drawFastVLine(x0 + r, y0 + xs, len, color);
2314 drawFastVLine(x0 + r, y0 - xe, len, color);
2315 drawFastVLine(x0 - r, y0 - xe, len, color);
2316 drawFastVLine(x0 - r, y0 + xs, len, color);
2317 }
2318 }
2319 else {
2320 ++xs;
2321 drawPixel(x0 - xe, y0 + r, color);
2322 drawPixel(x0 - xe, y0 - r, color);
2323 drawPixel(x0 + xs, y0 - r, color);
2324 drawPixel(x0 + xs, y0 + r, color);
2325
2326 drawPixel(x0 + r, y0 + xs, color);
2327 drawPixel(x0 + r, y0 - xe, color);
2328 drawPixel(x0 - r, y0 - xe, color);
2329 drawPixel(x0 - r, y0 + xs, color);
2330 }
2331 xs = xe;
2332 } while (xe < --r);
2333
2334 inTransaction = lockTransaction;
2335 end_tft_write(); // Does nothing if Sprite class uses this function
2336}

void TFT_eSPI::drawCircleHelper ( int32_t x,

int32_t r,
uint8_t cornername,

Definición en la línea 2343 del archivo TFT_eSPI.cpp.

2344{
2345 if (rr <= 0) return;
2346 int32_t f = 1 - rr;
2347 int32_t ddF_x = 1;
2348 int32_t ddF_y = -2 * rr;
2349 int32_t xe = 0;
2350 int32_t xs = 0;
2351 int32_t len = 0;
2352
2353 //begin_tft_write(); // Sprite class can use this function, avoiding begin_tft_write()
2354 inTransaction = true;
2355
2356 do
2357 {
2358 while (f < 0) {
2359 ++xe;
2360 f += (ddF_x += 2);
2361 }
2362 f += (ddF_y += 2);
2363
2364 if (xe-xs==1) {
2365 if (cornername & 0x1) { // left top
2366 drawPixel(x0 - xe, y0 - rr, color);
2367 drawPixel(x0 - rr, y0 - xe, color);
2368 }
2369 if (cornername & 0x2) { // right top
2370 drawPixel(x0 + rr , y0 - xe, color);
2371 drawPixel(x0 + xs + 1, y0 - rr, color);
2372 }
2373 if (cornername & 0x4) { // right bottom
2374 drawPixel(x0 + xs + 1, y0 + rr , color);
2375 drawPixel(x0 + rr, y0 + xs + 1, color);
2376 }
2377 if (cornername & 0x8) { // left bottom
2378 drawPixel(x0 - rr, y0 + xs + 1, color);
2379 drawPixel(x0 - xe, y0 + rr , color);
2380 }
2381 }
2382 else {
2383 len = xe - xs++;
2384 if (cornername & 0x1) { // left top
2385 drawFastHLine(x0 - xe, y0 - rr, len, color);
2386 drawFastVLine(x0 - rr, y0 - xe, len, color);
2387 }
2388 if (cornername & 0x2) { // right top
2389 drawFastVLine(x0 + rr, y0 - xe, len, color);
2390 drawFastHLine(x0 + xs, y0 - rr, len, color);
2391 }
2392 if (cornername & 0x4) { // right bottom
2393 drawFastHLine(x0 + xs, y0 + rr, len, color);
2394 drawFastVLine(x0 + rr, y0 + xs, len, color);
2395 }
2396 if (cornername & 0x8) { // left bottom
2397 drawFastVLine(x0 - rr, y0 + xs, len, color);
2398 drawFastHLine(x0 - xe, y0 + rr, len, color);
2399 }
2400 }
2401 xs = xe;
2402 } while (xe < rr--);
2403
2404 inTransaction = lockTransaction;
2405 end_tft_write(); // Does nothing if Sprite class uses this function
2406}

◆ drawEllipse()

void TFT_eSPI::drawEllipse ( int16_t x,
int16_t y,
int32_t rx,
int32_t ry,
uint16_t color )

Definición en la línea 2486 del archivo TFT_eSPI.cpp.

2487{
2488 if (rx<2) return;
2489 if (ry<2) return;
2490 int32_t x, y;
2491 int32_t rx2 = rx * rx;
2492 int32_t ry2 = ry * ry;
2493 int32_t fx2 = 4 * rx2;
2494 int32_t fy2 = 4 * ry2;
2495 int32_t s;
2496
2497 //begin_tft_write(); // Sprite class can use this function, avoiding begin_tft_write()
2498 inTransaction = true;
2499
2500 for (x = 0, y = ry, s = 2*ry2+rx2*(1-2*ry); ry2*x <= rx2*y; x++) {
2501 // These are ordered to minimise coordinate changes in x or y
2502 // drawPixel can then send fewer bounding box commands
2503 drawPixel(x0 + x, y0 + y, color);
2504 drawPixel(x0 - x, y0 + y, color);
2505 drawPixel(x0 - x, y0 - y, color);
2506 drawPixel(x0 + x, y0 - y, color);
2507 if (s >= 0) {
2508 s += fx2 * (1 - y);
2509 y--;
2510 }
2511 s += ry2 * ((4 * x) + 6);
2512 }
2513
2514 for (x = rx, y = 0, s = 2*rx2+ry2*(1-2*rx); rx2*y <= ry2*x; y++) {
2515 // These are ordered to minimise coordinate changes in x or y
2516 // drawPixel can then send fewer bounding box commands
2517 drawPixel(x0 + x, y0 + y, color);
2518 drawPixel(x0 - x, y0 + y, color);
2519 drawPixel(x0 - x, y0 - y, color);
2520 drawPixel(x0 + x, y0 - y, color);
2521 if (s >= 0)
2522 {
2523 s += fy2 * (1 - x);
2524 x--;
2525 }
2526 s += rx2 * ((4 * y) + 6);
2527 }
2528
2529 inTransaction = lockTransaction;
2530 end_tft_write(); // Does nothing if Sprite class uses this function
2531}

Hace referencia a drawPixel() y end_tft_write().

Referenciado por TFT_eSprite.

◆ drawFastHLine()

void TFT_eSPI::drawFastHLine ( int32_t x,
int32_t y,
int32_t w,
uint32_t color )

Definición en la línea 4629 del archivo TFT_eSPI.cpp.

4630{
4631 if (_vpOoB) return;
4632
4633 x+= _xDatum;
4634 y+= _yDatum;
4635
4636 // Clipping
4637 if ((y < _vpY) || (x >= _vpW) || (y >= _vpH)) return;
4638
4639 if (x < _vpX) { w += x - _vpX; x = _vpX; }
4640
4641 if ((x + w) > _vpW) w = _vpW - x;
4642
4643 if (w < 1) return;
4644
4645 begin_tft_write();
4646
4647 setWindow(x, y, x + w - 1, y);
4648
4649 pushBlock(color, w);
4650
4651 end_tft_write();
4652}

◆ drawFloat() [2/2]

int16_t TFT_eSPI::drawFloat ( float floatNumber,
uint8_t decimal,
int32_t x,
int32_t y,
uint8_t font )

Definición en la línea 5804 del archivo TFT_eSPI.cpp.

5805{
5806 isDigits = true;
5807 char str[14]; // Array to contain decimal string
5808 uint8_t ptr = 0; // Initialise pointer for array
5809 int8_t digits = 1; // Count the digits to avoid array overflow
5810 float rounding = 0.5; // Round up down delta
5811 bool negative = false;
5812
5813 if (dp > 7) dp = 7; // Limit the size of decimal portion
5814
5815 // Adjust the rounding value
5816 for (uint8_t i = 0; i < dp; ++i) rounding /= 10.0;
5817
5818 if (floatNumber < -rounding) { // add sign, avoid adding - sign to 0.0!
5819 str[ptr++] = '-'; // Negative number
5820 str[ptr] = 0; // Put a null in the array as a precaution
5821 digits = 0; // Set digits to 0 to compensate so pointer value can be used later
5822 floatNumber = -floatNumber; // Make positive
5823 negative = true;
5824 }
5825
5826 floatNumber += rounding; // Round up or down
5827
5828 if (dp == 0) {
5829 if (negative) floatNumber = -floatNumber;
5830 return drawNumber((long)floatNumber, poX, poY, font);
5831 }
5832
5833 // For error put ... in string and return (all TFT_eSPI library fonts contain . character)
5834 if (floatNumber >= 2147483647) {
5835 strcpy(str, "...");
5836 return drawString(str, poX, poY, font);
5837 }
5838 // No chance of overflow from here on
5839
5840 // Get integer part
5841 uint32_t temp = (uint32_t)floatNumber;
5842
5843 // Put integer part into array
5844 ltoa(temp, str + ptr, 10);
5845
5846 // Find out where the null is to get the digit count loaded
5847 while ((uint8_t)str[ptr] != 0) ptr++; // Move the pointer along
5848 digits += ptr; // Count the digits
5849
5850 str[ptr++] = '.'; // Add decimal point
5851 str[ptr] = '0'; // Add a dummy zero
5852 str[ptr + 1] = 0; // Add a null but don't increment pointer so it can be overwritten
5853
5854 // Get the decimal portion
5855 floatNumber = floatNumber - temp;
5856
5857 // Get decimal digits one by one and put in array
5858 // Limit digit count so we don't get a false sense of resolution
5859 uint8_t i = 0;
5860 while ((i < dp) && (digits < 9)) { // while (i < dp) for no limit but array size must be increased
5861 i++;
5862 floatNumber *= 10; // for the next decimal
5863 temp = floatNumber; // get the decimal
5864 ltoa(temp, str + ptr, 10);
5865 ptr++; digits++; // Increment pointer and digits count
5866 floatNumber -= temp; // Remove that digit
5867 }
5868
5869 // Finally we can plot the string and return pixel length
5870 return drawString(str, poX, poY, font);
5871}
TFT_eSPI::drawNumber
int16_t drawNumber(long intNumber, int32_t x, int32_t y, uint8_t font)
Definition TFT_eSPI.cpp:5784

Hace referencia a drawNumber(), drawString() y isDigits.

Referenciado por drawFloat() y TFT_eSprite.

◆ drawGlyph()

void TFT_eSPI::drawGlyph ( uint16_t code)
virtual

Reimplementado en TFT_eSprite.

Definición en la línea 360 del archivo Smooth_font.cpp.

361{
362 uint16_t fg = textcolor;
363 uint16_t bg = textbgcolor;
364
365 // Check if cursor has moved
366 if (last_cursor_x != cursor_x)
367 {
368 bg_cursor_x = cursor_x;
369 last_cursor_x = cursor_x;
370 }
371
372 if (code < 0x21)
373 {
374 if (code == 0x20) {
375 if (_fillbg) fillRect(bg_cursor_x, cursor_y, (cursor_x + gFont.spaceWidth) - bg_cursor_x, gFont.yAdvance, bg);
376 cursor_x += gFont.spaceWidth;
377 bg_cursor_x = cursor_x;
378 last_cursor_x = cursor_x;
379 return;
380 }
381
382 if (code == '\n') {
383 cursor_x = 0;
384 bg_cursor_x = 0;
385 last_cursor_x = 0;
386 cursor_y += gFont.yAdvance;
387 if (textwrapY && (cursor_y >= height())) cursor_y = 0;
388 return;
389 }
390 }
391
392 uint16_t gNum = 0;
393 bool found = getUnicodeIndex(code, &gNum);
394
395 if (found)
396 {
397
398 if (textwrapX && (cursor_x + gWidth[gNum] + gdX[gNum] > width()))
399 {
400 cursor_y += gFont.yAdvance;
401 cursor_x = 0;
402 bg_cursor_x = 0;
403 }
404 if (textwrapY && ((cursor_y + gFont.yAdvance) >= height())) cursor_y = 0;
405 if (cursor_x == 0) cursor_x -= gdX[gNum];
406
407 uint8_t* pbuffer = nullptr;
408 const uint8_t* gPtr = (const uint8_t*) gFont.gArray;
409
410#ifdef FONT_FS_AVAILABLE
411 if (fs_font)
412 {
413 fontFile.seek(gBitmap[gNum], fs::SeekSet);
414 pbuffer = (uint8_t*)malloc(gWidth[gNum]);
415 }
416#endif
417
418 int16_t cy = cursor_y + gFont.maxAscent - gdY[gNum];
419 int16_t cx = cursor_x + gdX[gNum];
420
421 // if (cx > width() && bg_cursor_x > width()) return;
422 // if (cursor_y > height()) return;
423
424 int16_t fxs = cx;
425 uint32_t fl = 0;
426 int16_t bxs = cx;
427 uint32_t bl = 0;
428 int16_t bx = 0;
429 uint8_t pixel;
430
431 startWrite(); // Avoid slow ESP32 transaction overhead for every pixel
432
433 int16_t fillwidth = 0;
434 int16_t fillheight = 0;
435
436 // Fill area above glyph
437 if (_fillbg) {
438 fillwidth = (cursor_x + gxAdvance[gNum]) - bg_cursor_x;
439 if (fillwidth > 0) {
440 fillheight = gFont.maxAscent - gdY[gNum];
441 // Could be negative
442 if (fillheight > 0) {
443 fillRect(bg_cursor_x, cursor_y, fillwidth, fillheight, textbgcolor);
444 }
445 }
446 else {
447 // Could be negative
448 fillwidth = 0;
449 }
450
451 // Fill any area to left of glyph
452 if (bg_cursor_x < cx) fillRect(bg_cursor_x, cy, cx - bg_cursor_x, gHeight[gNum], textbgcolor);
453 // Set x position in glyph area where background starts
454 if (bg_cursor_x > cx) bx = bg_cursor_x - cx;
455 // Fill any area to right of glyph
456 if (cx + gWidth[gNum] < cursor_x + gxAdvance[gNum]) {
457 fillRect(cx + gWidth[gNum], cy, (cursor_x + gxAdvance[gNum]) - (cx + gWidth[gNum]), gHeight[gNum], textbgcolor);
458 }
459 }
460
461 for (int32_t y = 0; y < gHeight[gNum]; y++)
462 {
463#ifdef FONT_FS_AVAILABLE
464 if (fs_font) {
465 if (spiffs)
466 {
467 fontFile.read(pbuffer, gWidth[gNum]);
468 //Serial.println("SPIFFS");
469 }
470 else
471 {
472 endWrite(); // Release SPI for SD card transaction
473 fontFile.read(pbuffer, gWidth[gNum]);
474 startWrite(); // Re-start SPI for TFT transaction
475 //Serial.println("Not SPIFFS");
476 }
477 }
478#endif
479
480 for (int32_t x = 0; x < gWidth[gNum]; x++)
481 {
482#ifdef FONT_FS_AVAILABLE
483 if (fs_font) pixel = pbuffer[x];
484 else
485#endif
486 pixel = pgm_read_byte(gPtr + gBitmap[gNum] + x + gWidth[gNum] * y);
487
488 if (pixel)
489 {
490 if (bl) { drawFastHLine( bxs, y + cy, bl, bg); bl = 0; }
491 if (pixel != 0xFF)
492 {
493 if (fl) {
494 if (fl==1) drawPixel(fxs, y + cy, fg);
495 else drawFastHLine( fxs, y + cy, fl, fg);
496 fl = 0;
497 }
498 if (getColor) bg = getColor(x + cx, y + cy);
499 drawPixel(x + cx, y + cy, alphaBlend(pixel, fg, bg));
500 }
501 else
502 {
503 if (fl==0) fxs = x + cx;
504 fl++;
505 }
506 }
507 else
508 {
509 if (fl) { drawFastHLine( fxs, y + cy, fl, fg); fl = 0; }
510 if (_fillbg) {
511 if (x >= bx) {
512 if (bl==0) bxs = x + cx;
513 bl++;
514 }
515 }
516 }
517 }
518 if (fl) { drawFastHLine( fxs, y + cy, fl, fg); fl = 0; }
519 if (bl) { drawFastHLine( bxs, y + cy, bl, bg); bl = 0; }
520 }
521
522 // Fill area below glyph
523 if (fillwidth > 0) {
524 fillheight = (cursor_y + gFont.yAdvance) - (cy + gHeight[gNum]);
525 if (fillheight > 0) {
526 fillRect(bg_cursor_x, cy + gHeight[gNum], fillwidth, fillheight, textbgcolor);
527 }
528 }
529
530 if (pbuffer) free(pbuffer);
531 cursor_x += gxAdvance[gNum];
532 endWrite();
533 }
534 else
535 {
536 // Point code not in font so draw a rectangle and move on cursor
537 drawRect(cursor_x, cursor_y + gFont.maxAscent - gFont.ascent, gFont.spaceWidth, gFont.ascent, fg);
538 cursor_x += gFont.spaceWidth + 1;
539 }
540 bg_cursor_x = cursor_x;
541 last_cursor_x = cursor_x;
542}
TFT_eSPI::startWrite
void startWrite(void)
Definition TFT_eSPI.cpp:3818
TFT_eSPI::gHeight
uint8_t * gHeight
Definition TFT_eSPI.h:37
TFT_eSPI::gWidth

◆ drawLine()

void TFT_eSPI::drawLine ( int32_t xs,
int32_t ys,
int32_t xe,
int32_t ye,
uint32_t color )

Definición en la línea 3884 del archivo TFT_eSPI.cpp.

3885{
3886 if (_vpOoB) return;
3887
3888 //begin_tft_write(); // Sprite class can use this function, avoiding begin_tft_write()
3889 inTransaction = true;
3890
3891 //x+= _xDatum; // Not added here, added by drawPixel & drawFastXLine
3892 //y+= _yDatum;
3893
3894 bool steep = abs(y1 - y0) > abs(x1 - x0);
3895 if (steep) {
3896 transpose(x0, y0);
3897 transpose(x1, y1);
3898 }
3899
3900 if (x0 > x1) {
3901 transpose(x0, x1);
3902 transpose(y0, y1);
3903 }
3904
3905 int32_t dx = x1 - x0, dy = abs(y1 - y0);;
3906
3907 int32_t err = dx >> 1, ystep = -1, xs = x0, dlen = 0;
3908
3909 if (y0 < y1) ystep = 1;
3910
3911 // Split into steep and not steep for FastH/V separation
3912 if (steep) {
3913 for (; x0 <= x1; x0++) {
3914 dlen++;
3915 err -= dy;
3916 if (err < 0) {
3917 if (dlen == 1) drawPixel(y0, xs, color);
3918 else drawFastVLine(y0, xs, dlen, color);
3919 dlen = 0;
3920 y0 += ystep; xs = x0 + 1;
3921 err += dx;
3922 }
3923 }
3924 if (dlen) drawFastVLine(y0, xs, dlen, color);
3925 }
3926 else
3927 {
3928 for (; x0 <= x1; x0++) {
3929 dlen++;
3930 err -= dy;
3931 if (err < 0) {
3932 if (dlen == 1) drawPixel(xs, y0, color);
3933 else drawFastHLine(xs, y0, dlen, color);
3934 dlen = 0;
3935 y0 += ystep; xs = x0 + 1;
3936 err += dx;
3937 }
3938 }
3939 if (dlen) drawFastHLine(xs, y0, dlen, color);
3940 }
3941
3942 inTransaction = lockTransaction;
3943 end_tft_write();
3944}

Hace referencia a _vpOoB, drawFastHLine(), drawFastVLine(), drawPixel() y end_tft_write().

Referenciado por calibrateTouch(), drawTriangle() y TFT_eSprite.

◆ drawPixel() [1/2]

void TFT_eSPI::drawPixel ( int32_t x,
int32_t y,
uint32_t color )
virtual

Reimplementado en TFT_eSprite.

Definición en la línea 3582 del archivo TFT_eSPI.cpp.

3583{
3584 if (_vpOoB) return;
3585
3586 x+= _xDatum;
3587 y+= _yDatum;
3588
3589 // Range checking
3590 if ((x < _vpX) || (y < _vpY) ||(x >= _vpW) || (y >= _vpH)) return;
3591
3592#ifdef CGRAM_OFFSET
3593 x+=colstart;
3594 y+=rowstart;
3595#endif
3596
3597#if (defined (MULTI_TFT_SUPPORT) || defined (GC9A01_DRIVER)) && !defined (ILI9225_DRIVER)
3598 addr_row = 0xFFFF;
3599 addr_col = 0xFFFF;
3600#endif
3601
3602 begin_tft_write();
3603
3604#if defined (ILI9225_DRIVER)
3605 if (rotation & 0x01) { transpose(x, y); }
3606 SPI_BUSY_CHECK;
3607
3608 // Set window to full screen to optimise sequential pixel rendering
3609 if (addr_row != 0x9225) {
3610 addr_row = 0x9225; // addr_row used for flag
3611 DC_C; tft_Write_8(TFT_CASET1);
3612 DC_D; tft_Write_16(0);
3613 DC_C; tft_Write_8(TFT_CASET2);
3614 DC_D; tft_Write_16(175);
3615
3616 DC_C; tft_Write_8(TFT_PASET1);
3617 DC_D; tft_Write_16(0);
3618 DC_C; tft_Write_8(TFT_PASET2);
3619 DC_D; tft_Write_16(219);
3620 }
3621
3622 // Define pixel coordinate
3623 DC_C; tft_Write_8(TFT_RAM_ADDR1);
3624 DC_D; tft_Write_16(x);
3625 DC_C; tft_Write_8(TFT_RAM_ADDR2);
3626 DC_D; tft_Write_16(y);
3627
3628 // write to RAM
3629 DC_C; tft_Write_8(TFT_RAMWR);
3630 #if defined(TFT_PARALLEL_8_BIT) || defined(TFT_PARALLEL_16_BIT) || !defined(ESP32)
3631 DC_D; tft_Write_16(color);
3632 #else
3633 DC_D; tft_Write_16N(color);
3634 #endif
3635
3636// Temporary solution is to include the RP2040 optimised code here
3637#elif (defined (ARDUINO_ARCH_RP2040) || defined (ARDUINO_ARCH_MBED)) && !defined (SSD1351_DRIVER)
3638
3639 #if defined (SSD1963_DRIVER)
3640 if ((rotation & 0x1) == 0) { transpose(x, y); }
3641 #endif
3642
3643 #if !defined(RP2040_PIO_INTERFACE)
3644 while (spi_get_hw(SPI_X)->sr & SPI_SSPSR_BSY_BITS) {};
3645
3646 #if defined (RPI_DISPLAY_TYPE) // RPi TFT type always needs 16-bit transfers
3647 hw_write_masked(&spi_get_hw(SPI_X)->cr0, (16 - 1) << SPI_SSPCR0_DSS_LSB, SPI_SSPCR0_DSS_BITS);
3648 #else
3649 hw_write_masked(&spi_get_hw(SPI_X)->cr0, (8 - 1) << SPI_SSPCR0_DSS_LSB, SPI_SSPCR0_DSS_BITS);
3650 #endif
3651
3652 if (addr_col != x) {
3653 DC_C;
3654 spi_get_hw(SPI_X)->dr = (uint32_t)TFT_CASET;
3655 while (spi_get_hw(SPI_X)->sr & SPI_SSPSR_BSY_BITS){};
3656 DC_D;
3657 spi_get_hw(SPI_X)->dr = (uint32_t)x>>8;
3658 spi_get_hw(SPI_X)->dr = (uint32_t)x;
3659 spi_get_hw(SPI_X)->dr = (uint32_t)x>>8;
3660 spi_get_hw(SPI_X)->dr = (uint32_t)x;
3661 addr_col = x;
3662 while (spi_get_hw(SPI_X)->sr & SPI_SSPSR_BSY_BITS) {};
3663 }
3664
3665 if (addr_row != y) {
3666 DC_C;
3667 spi_get_hw(SPI_X)->dr = (uint32_t)TFT_PASET;
3668 while (spi_get_hw(SPI_X)->sr & SPI_SSPSR_BSY_BITS) {};
3669 DC_D;
3670 spi_get_hw(SPI_X)->dr = (uint32_t)y>>8;
3671 spi_get_hw(SPI_X)->dr = (uint32_t)y;
3672 spi_get_hw(SPI_X)->dr = (uint32_t)y>>8;
3673 spi_get_hw(SPI_X)->dr = (uint32_t)y;
3674 addr_row = y;
3675 while (spi_get_hw(SPI_X)->sr & SPI_SSPSR_BSY_BITS) {};
3676 }
3677
3678 DC_C;
3679 spi_get_hw(SPI_X)->dr = (uint32_t)TFT_RAMWR;
3680
3681 #if defined (SPI_18BIT_DRIVER) // SPI 18-bit colour
3682 uint8_t r = (color & 0xF800)>>8;
3683 uint8_t g = (color & 0x07E0)>>3;
3684 uint8_t b = (color & 0x001F)<<3;
3685 while (spi_get_hw(SPI_X)->sr & SPI_SSPSR_BSY_BITS) {};
3686 DC_D;
3687 tft_Write_8N(r); tft_Write_8N(g); tft_Write_8N(b);
3688 #else
3689 while (spi_get_hw(SPI_X)->sr & SPI_SSPSR_BSY_BITS) {};
3690 DC_D;
3691 #if defined (RPI_DISPLAY_TYPE) // RPi TFT type always needs 16-bit transfers
3692 spi_get_hw(SPI_X)->dr = (uint32_t)color;
3693 #else
3694 spi_get_hw(SPI_X)->dr = (uint32_t)color>>8;
3695 spi_get_hw(SPI_X)->dr = (uint32_t)color;
3696 #endif
3697 #endif
3698 while (spi_get_hw(SPI_X)->sr & SPI_SSPSR_BSY_BITS) {};
3699 #elif defined (RM68120_DRIVER)
3700 if (addr_col != x) {
3701 DC_C; tft_Write_16(TFT_CASET+0); DC_D; tft_Write_16(x >> 8);
3702 DC_C; tft_Write_16(TFT_CASET+1); DC_D; tft_Write_16(x & 0xFF);
3703 DC_C; tft_Write_16(TFT_CASET+2); DC_D; tft_Write_16(x >> 8);
3704 DC_C; tft_Write_16(TFT_CASET+3); DC_D; tft_Write_16(x & 0xFF);
3705 addr_col = x;
3706 }
3707 if (addr_row != y) {
3708 DC_C; tft_Write_16(TFT_PASET+0); DC_D; tft_Write_16(y >> 8);
3709 DC_C; tft_Write_16(TFT_PASET+1); DC_D; tft_Write_16(y & 0xFF);
3710 DC_C; tft_Write_16(TFT_PASET+2); DC_D; tft_Write_16(y >> 8);
3711 DC_C; tft_Write_16(TFT_PASET+3); DC_D; tft_Write_16(y & 0xFF);
3712 addr_row = y;
3713 }
3714 DC_C; tft_Write_16(TFT_RAMWR); DC_D;
3715
3716 TX_FIFO = color;
3717 #else
3718 // This is for the RP2040 and PIO interface (SPI or parallel)
3719 WAIT_FOR_STALL;
3720 tft_pio->sm[pio_sm].instr = pio_instr_addr;
3721 TX_FIFO = TFT_CASET;
3722 TX_FIFO = (x<<16) | x;
3723 TX_FIFO = TFT_PASET;
3724 TX_FIFO = (y<<16) | y;
3725 TX_FIFO = TFT_RAMWR;
3726 //DC set high by PIO
3727 #if defined (SPI_18BIT_DRIVER) || (defined (SSD1963_DRIVER) && defined (TFT_PARALLEL_8_BIT))
3728 TX_FIFO = ((color & 0xF800)<<8) | ((color & 0x07E0)<<5) | ((color & 0x001F)<<3);
3729 #else
3730 TX_FIFO = color;
3731 #endif
3732
3733 #endif
3734
3735#else
3736
3737 #if defined (SSD1963_DRIVER)
3738 if ((rotation & 0x1) == 0) { transpose(x, y); }
3739 #endif
3740
3741 SPI_BUSY_CHECK;
3742
3743 #if defined (SSD1351_DRIVER)
3744 if (rotation & 0x1) { transpose(x, y); }
3745 // No need to send x if it has not changed (speeds things up)
3746 if (addr_col != x) {
3747 DC_C; tft_Write_8(TFT_CASET);
3748 DC_D; tft_Write_16(x | (x << 8));
3749 addr_col = x;
3750 }
3751
3752 // No need to send y if it has not changed (speeds things up)
3753 if (addr_row != y) {
3754 DC_C; tft_Write_8(TFT_PASET);
3755 DC_D; tft_Write_16(y | (y << 8));
3756 addr_row = y;
3757 }
3758 #else
3759 // No need to send x if it has not changed (speeds things up)
3760 if (addr_col != x) {
3761 DC_C; tft_Write_8(TFT_CASET);
3762 DC_D; tft_Write_32D(x);
3763 addr_col = x;
3764 }
3765
3766 // No need to send y if it has not changed (speeds things up)
3767 if (addr_row != y) {
3768 DC_C; tft_Write_8(TFT_PASET);
3769 DC_D; tft_Write_32D(y);
3770 addr_row = y;
3771 }
3772 #endif
3773
3774 DC_C; tft_Write_8(TFT_RAMWR);
3775
3776 #if defined(TFT_PARALLEL_8_BIT) || defined(TFT_PARALLEL_16_BIT) || !defined(ESP32)
3777 DC_D; tft_Write_16(color);
3778 #else
3779 DC_D; tft_Write_16N(color);
3780 #endif
3781#endif
3782
3783 end_tft_write();
3784}

◆ drawSmoothArc()

void TFT_eSPI::drawSmoothArc ( int32_t x,
int32_t y,
int32_t r,
int32_t ir,
uint32_t startAngle,
uint32_t endAngle,
uint32_t fg_color,
uint32_t bg_color,
bool roundEnds = false )

Definición en la línea 3972 del archivo TFT_eSPI.cpp.

3979{
3980 inTransaction = true;
3981
3982 if (endAngle != startAngle && (startAngle != 0 || endAngle != 360))
3983 {
3984 float sx = -sinf(startAngle * deg2rad);
3985 float sy = +cosf(startAngle * deg2rad);
3986 float ex = -sinf( endAngle * deg2rad);
3987 float ey = +cosf( endAngle * deg2rad);
3988
3989 if (roundEnds)
3990 { // Round ends
3991 sx = sx * (r + ir)/2.0 + x;
3992 sy = sy * (r + ir)/2.0 + y;
3993 drawSpot(sx, sy, (r - ir)/2.0, fg_color, bg_color);
3994
3995 ex = ex * (r + ir)/2.0 + x;
3996 ey = ey * (r + ir)/2.0 + y;
3997 drawSpot(ex, ey, (r - ir)/2.0, fg_color, bg_color);
3998 }
3999 else
4000 { // Square ends
4001 float asx = sx * ir + x;
4002 float asy = sy * ir + y;
4003 float aex = sx * r + x;
4004 float aey = sy * r + y;
4005 drawWedgeLine(asx, asy, aex, aey, 0.3, 0.3, fg_color, bg_color);
4006
4007 asx = ex * ir + x;
4008 asy = ey * ir + y;
4009 aex = ex * r + x;
4010 aey = ey * r + y;
4011 drawWedgeLine(asx, asy, aex, aey, 0.3, 0.3, fg_color, bg_color);
4012 }
4013
4014 // Draw arc
4015 drawArc(x, y, r, ir, startAngle, endAngle, fg_color, bg_color);
4016
4017 }
4018 else // Draw full 360
4019 {
4020 drawArc(x, y, r, ir, 0, 360, fg_color, bg_color);
4021 }
4022
4023 inTransaction = lockTransaction;
4024 end_tft_write();
4025}
TFT_eSPI::drawSpot
void drawSpot(float ax, float ay, float r, uint32_t fg_color, uint32_t bg_color=0x00FFFFFF)

◆ drawSmoothCircle()

void TFT_eSPI::drawSmoothCircle ( int32_t x,
int32_t y,
int32_t r,
uint32_t fg_color,
uint32_t bg_color )

Definición en la línea 4237 del archivo TFT_eSPI.cpp.

4239 drawSmoothRoundRect(x-r, y-r, r, r-1, 0, 0, fg_color, bg_color);
4240}
TFT_eSPI::drawSmoothRoundRect
void drawSmoothRoundRect(int32_t x, int32_t y, int32_t r, int32_t ir, int32_t w, int32_t h, uint32_t fg_color, uint32_t bg_color=0x00FFFFFF, uint8_t quadrants=0xF)
Definition TFT_eSPI.cpp:4309

Hace referencia a drawSmoothRoundRect().

Referenciado por TFT_eSprite.

◆ drawSmoothRoundRect()

void TFT_eSPI::drawSmoothRoundRect ( int32_t x,
int32_t y,
int32_t r,
int32_t ir,
int32_t w,
int32_t h,
uint32_t fg_color,
uint32_t bg_color = 0x00FFFFFF,
uint8_t quadrants = 0xF )

Definición en la línea 4309 del archivo TFT_eSPI.cpp.

4310{
4311 if (_vpOoB) return;
4312 if (r < ir) transpose(r, ir); // Required that r > ir
4313 if (r <= 0 || ir < 0) return; // Invalid
4314
4315 w -= 2*r;
4316 h -= 2*r;
4317
4318 if (w < 0) w = 0;
4319 if (h < 0) h = 0;
4320
4321 inTransaction = true;
4322
4323 x += r;
4324 y += r;
4325
4326 uint16_t t = r - ir + 1;
4327 int32_t xs = 0;
4328 int32_t cx = 0;
4329
4330 int32_t r2 = r * r; // Outer arc radius^2
4331 r++;
4332 int32_t r1 = r * r; // Outer AA zone radius^2
4333
4334 int32_t r3 = ir * ir; // Inner arc radius^2
4335 ir--;
4336 int32_t r4 = ir * ir; // Inner AA zone radius^2
4337
4338 uint8_t alpha = 0;
4339
4340 // Scan top left quadrant x y r ir fg_color bg_color
4341 for (int32_t cy = r - 1; cy > 0; cy--)
4342 {
4343 int32_t len = 0; // Pixel run length
4344 int32_t lxst = 0; // Left side run x start
4345 int32_t rxst = 0; // Right side run x start
4346 int32_t dy2 = (r - cy) * (r - cy);
4347
4348 // Find and track arc zone start point
4349 while ((r - xs) * (r - xs) + dy2 >= r1) xs++;
4350
4351 for (cx = xs; cx < r; cx++)
4352 {
4353 // Calculate radius^2
4354 int32_t hyp = (r - cx) * (r - cx) + dy2;
4355
4356 // If in outer zone calculate alpha
4357 if (hyp > r2) {
4358 alpha = ~sqrt_fraction(hyp); // Outer AA zone
4359 }
4360 // If within arc fill zone, get line lengths for each quadrant
4361 else if (hyp >= r3) {
4362 rxst = cx; // Right side start
4363 len++; // Line segment length
4364 continue; // Next x
4365 }
4366 else {
4367 if (hyp <= r4) break; // Skip inner pixels
4368 alpha = sqrt_fraction(hyp); // Inner AA zone
4369 }
4370
4371 if (alpha < 16) continue; // Skip low alpha pixels
4372
4373 // If background is read it must be done in each quadrant - TODO
4374 uint16_t pcol = fastBlend(alpha, fg_color, bg_color);
4375 if (quadrants & 0x8) drawPixel(x + cx - r, y - cy + r + h, pcol); // BL
4376 if (quadrants & 0x1) drawPixel(x + cx - r, y + cy - r, pcol); // TL
4377 if (quadrants & 0x2) drawPixel(x - cx + r + w, y + cy - r, pcol); // TR
4378 if (quadrants & 0x4) drawPixel(x - cx + r + w, y - cy + r + h, pcol); // BR
4379 }
4380 // Fill arc inner zone in each quadrant
4381 lxst = rxst - len + 1; // Calculate line segment start for left side
4382 if (quadrants & 0x8) drawFastHLine(x + lxst - r, y - cy + r + h, len, fg_color); // BL
4383 if (quadrants & 0x1) drawFastHLine(x + lxst - r, y + cy - r, len, fg_color); // TL
4384 if (quadrants & 0x2) drawFastHLine(x - rxst + r + w, y + cy - r, len, fg_color); // TR
4385 if (quadrants & 0x4) drawFastHLine(x - rxst + r + w, y - cy + r + h, len, fg_color); // BR
4386 }
4387
4388 // Draw sides
4389 if ((quadrants & 0xC) == 0xC) fillRect(x, y + r - t + h, w + 1, t, fg_color); // Bottom
4390 if ((quadrants & 0x9) == 0x9) fillRect(x - r + 1, y, t, h + 1, fg_color); // Left
4391 if ((quadrants & 0x3) == 0x3) fillRect(x, y - r + 1, w + 1, t, fg_color); // Top
4392 if ((quadrants & 0x6) == 0x6) fillRect(x + r - t + w, y, t, h + 1, fg_color); // Right
4393
4394 inTransaction = lockTransaction;
4395 end_tft_write();
4396}

Hace referencia a _vpOoB, drawFastHLine(), drawPixel(), end_tft_write() y fillRect().

Referenciado por drawSmoothCircle() y TFT_eSprite.

◆ drawString() [2/4]

int16_t TFT_eSPI::drawString ( const char * string,
int32_t x,
int32_t y,
uint8_t font )

Definición en la línea 5504 del archivo TFT_eSPI.cpp.

5505{
5506 if (font > 8) return 0;
5507
5508 int16_t sumX = 0;
5509 uint8_t padding = 1, baseline = 0;
5510 uint16_t cwidth = textWidth(string, font); // Find the pixel width of the string in the font
5511 uint16_t cheight = 8 * textsize;
5512
5513#ifdef LOAD_GFXFF
5514 #ifdef SMOOTH_FONT
5515 bool freeFont = (font == 1 && gfxFont && !fontLoaded);
5516 #else
5517 bool freeFont = (font == 1 && gfxFont);
5518 #endif
5519
5520 if (freeFont) {
5521 cheight = glyph_ab * textsize;
5522 poY += cheight; // Adjust for baseline datum of free fonts
5523 baseline = cheight;
5524 padding =101; // Different padding method used for Free Fonts
5525
5526 // We need to make an adjustment for the bottom of the string (eg 'y' character)
5527 if ((textdatum == BL_DATUM) || (textdatum == BC_DATUM) || (textdatum == BR_DATUM)) {
5528 cheight += glyph_bb * textsize;
5529 }
5530 }
5531#endif
5532
5533
5534 // If it is not font 1 (GLCD or free font) get the baseline and pixel height of the font
5535#ifdef SMOOTH_FONT
5536 if(fontLoaded) {
5537 baseline = gFont.maxAscent;
5538 cheight = fontHeight();
5539 }
5540 else
5541#endif
5542 if (font!=1) {
5543 baseline = pgm_read_byte( &fontdata[font].baseline ) * textsize;
5544 cheight = fontHeight(font);
5545 }
5546
5547 if (textdatum || padX) {
5548
5549 switch(textdatum) {
5550 case TC_DATUM:
5551 poX -= cwidth/2;
5552 padding += 1;
5553 break;
5554 case TR_DATUM:
5555 poX -= cwidth;
5556 padding += 2;
5557 break;
5558 case ML_DATUM:
5559 poY -= cheight/2;
5560 //padding += 0;
5561 break;
5562 case MC_DATUM:
5563 poX -= cwidth/2;
5564 poY -= cheight/2;
5565 padding += 1;
5566 break;
5567 case MR_DATUM:
5568 poX -= cwidth;
5569 poY -= cheight/2;
5570 padding += 2;
5571 break;
5572 case BL_DATUM:
5573 poY -= cheight;
5574 //padding += 0;
5575 break;
5576 case BC_DATUM:
5577 poX -= cwidth/2;
5578 poY -= cheight;
5579 padding += 1;
5580 break;
5581 case BR_DATUM:
5582 poX -= cwidth;
5583 poY -= cheight;
5584 padding += 2;
5585 break;
5586 case L_BASELINE:
5587 poY -= baseline;
5588 //padding += 0;
5589 break;
5590 case C_BASELINE:
5591 poX -= cwidth/2;
5592 poY -= baseline;
5593 padding += 1;
5594 break;
5595 case R_BASELINE:
5596 poX -= cwidth;
5597 poY -= baseline;
5598 padding += 2;
5599 break;
5600 }
5601 }
5602
5603
5604 int8_t xo = 0;
5605#ifdef LOAD_GFXFF
5606 if (freeFont && (textcolor!=textbgcolor)) {
5607 cheight = (glyph_ab + glyph_bb) * textsize;
5608 // Get the offset for the first character only to allow for negative offsets
5609 uint16_t c2 = 0;
5610 uint16_t len = strlen(string);
5611 uint16_t n = 0;
5612
5613 while (n < len && c2 == 0) c2 = decodeUTF8((uint8_t*)string, &n, len - n);
5614
5615 if((c2 >= pgm_read_word(&gfxFont->first)) && (c2 <= pgm_read_word(&gfxFont->last) )) {
5616 c2 -= pgm_read_word(&gfxFont->first);
5617 GFXglyph *glyph = &(((GFXglyph *)pgm_read_dword(&gfxFont->glyph))[c2]);
5618 xo = pgm_read_byte(&glyph->xOffset) * textsize;
5619 // Adjust for negative xOffset
5620 if (xo > 0) xo = 0;
5621 else cwidth -= xo;
5622 // Add 1 pixel of padding all round
5623 //cheight +=2;
5624 //fillRect(poX+xo-1, poY - 1 - glyph_ab * textsize, cwidth+2, cheight, textbgcolor);
5625 fillRect(poX+xo, poY - glyph_ab * textsize, cwidth, cheight, textbgcolor);
5626 }
5627 padding -=100;
5628 }
5629#endif
5630
5631 uint16_t len = strlen(string);
5632 uint16_t n = 0;
5633
5634#ifdef SMOOTH_FONT
5635 if(fontLoaded) {
5636 setCursor(poX, poY);
5637
5638 bool fillbg = _fillbg;
5639 // If padding is requested then fill the text background
5640 if (padX && !_fillbg) _fillbg = true;
5641
5642 while (n < len) {
5643 uint16_t uniCode = decodeUTF8((uint8_t*)string, &n, len - n);
5644 drawGlyph(uniCode);
5645 }
5646 _fillbg = fillbg; // restore state
5647 sumX += cwidth;
5648 //fontFile.close();
5649 }
5650 else
5651#endif
5652 {
5653 while (n < len) {
5654 uint16_t uniCode = decodeUTF8((uint8_t*)string, &n, len - n);
5655 sumX += drawChar(uniCode, poX+sumX, poY, font);
5656 }
5657 }
5658
5659//vvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvv DEBUG vvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvv
5660// Switch on debugging for the padding areas
5661//#define PADDING_DEBUG
5662
5663#ifndef PADDING_DEBUG
5664//^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ DEBUG ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
5665
5666 if((padX>cwidth) && (textcolor!=textbgcolor)) {
5667 int16_t padXc = poX+cwidth+xo;
5668#ifdef LOAD_GFXFF
5669 if (freeFont) {
5670 poX +=xo; // Adjust for negative offset start character
5671 poY -= glyph_ab * textsize;
5672 sumX += poX;
5673 }
5674#endif
5675 switch(padding) {
5676 case 1:
5677 fillRect(padXc,poY,padX-cwidth,cheight, textbgcolor);
5678 break;
5679 case 2:
5680 fillRect(padXc,poY,(padX-cwidth)>>1,cheight, textbgcolor);
5681 padXc = poX - ((padX-cwidth)>>1);
5682 fillRect(padXc,poY,(padX-cwidth)>>1,cheight, textbgcolor);
5683 break;
5684 case 3:
5685 if (padXc>padX) padXc = padX;
5686 fillRect(poX + cwidth - padXc,poY,padXc-cwidth,cheight, textbgcolor);
5687 break;
5688 }
5689 }
5690
5691
5692#else
5693
5694//vvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvv DEBUG vvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvv
5695// This is debug code to show text (green box) and blanked (white box) areas
5696// It shows that the padding areas are being correctly sized and positioned
5697
5698 if((padX>sumX) && (textcolor!=textbgcolor)) {
5699 int16_t padXc = poX+sumX; // Maximum left side padding
5700#ifdef LOAD_GFXFF
5701 if ((font == 1) && (gfxFont)) poY -= glyph_ab;
5702#endif
5703 drawRect(poX,poY,sumX,cheight, TFT_GREEN);
5704 switch(padding) {
5705 case 1:
5706 drawRect(padXc,poY,padX-sumX,cheight, TFT_WHITE);
5707 break;
5708 case 2:
5709 drawRect(padXc,poY,(padX-sumX)>>1, cheight, TFT_WHITE);
5710 padXc = (padX-sumX)>>1;
5711 drawRect(poX - padXc,poY,(padX-sumX)>>1,cheight, TFT_WHITE);
5712 break;
5713 case 3:
5714 if (padXc>padX) padXc = padX;
5715 drawRect(poX + sumX - padXc,poY,padXc-sumX,cheight, TFT_WHITE);
5716 break;
5717 }
5718 }
5719#endif
5720//^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ DEBUG ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
5721
5722return sumX;
5723}
R_BASELINE
#define R_BASELINE

◆ drawWedgeLine()

void TFT_eSPI::drawWedgeLine ( float ax,
float ay,
float bx,
float by,
float aw,
float bw,
uint32_t fg_color,
uint32_t bg_color = 0x00FFFFFF )

Definición en la línea 4476 del archivo TFT_eSPI.cpp.

4477{
4478 if ( (ar < 0.0) || (br < 0.0) )return;
4479 if ( (fabsf(ax - bx) < 0.01f) && (fabsf(ay - by) < 0.01f) ) bx += 0.01f; // Avoid divide by zero
4480
4481 // Find line bounding box
4482 int32_t x0 = (int32_t)floorf(fminf(ax-ar, bx-br));
4483 int32_t x1 = (int32_t) ceilf(fmaxf(ax+ar, bx+br));
4484 int32_t y0 = (int32_t)floorf(fminf(ay-ar, by-br));
4485 int32_t y1 = (int32_t) ceilf(fmaxf(ay+ar, by+br));
4486
4487 if (!clipWindow(&x0, &y0, &x1, &y1)) return;
4488
4489 // Establish x start and y start
4490 int32_t ys = ay;
4491 if ((ax-ar)>(bx-br)) ys = by;
4492
4493 float rdt = ar - br; // Radius delta
4494 float alpha = 1.0f;
4495 ar += 0.5;
4496
4497 uint16_t bg = bg_color;
4498 float xpax, ypay, bax = bx - ax, bay = by - ay;
4499
4500 begin_nin_write();
4501 inTransaction = true;
4502
4503 int32_t xs = x0;
4504 // Scan bounding box from ys down, calculate pixel intensity from distance to line
4505 for (int32_t yp = ys; yp <= y1; yp++) {
4506 bool swin = true; // Flag to start new window area
4507 bool endX = false; // Flag to skip pixels
4508 ypay = yp - ay;
4509 for (int32_t xp = xs; xp <= x1; xp++) {
4510 if (endX) if (alpha <= LoAlphaTheshold) break; // Skip right side
4511 xpax = xp - ax;
4512 alpha = ar - wedgeLineDistance(xpax, ypay, bax, bay, rdt);
4513 if (alpha <= LoAlphaTheshold ) continue;
4514 // Track edge to minimise calculations
4515 if (!endX) { endX = true; xs = xp; }
4516 if (alpha > HiAlphaTheshold) {
4517 #ifdef GC9A01_DRIVER
4518 drawPixel(xp, yp, fg_color);
4519 #else
4520 if (swin) { setWindow(xp, yp, x1, yp); swin = false; }
4521 pushColor(fg_color);
4522 #endif
4523 continue;
4524 }
4525 //Blend color with background and plot
4526 if (bg_color == 0x00FFFFFF) {
4527 bg = readPixel(xp, yp); swin = true;
4528 }
4529 #ifdef GC9A01_DRIVER
4530 uint16_t pcol = fastBlend((uint8_t)(alpha * PixelAlphaGain), fg_color, bg);
4531 drawPixel(xp, yp, pcol);
4532 swin = swin;
4533 #else
4534 if (swin) { setWindow(xp, yp, x1, yp); swin = false; }
4535 pushColor(fastBlend((uint8_t)(alpha * PixelAlphaGain), fg_color, bg));
4536 #endif
4537 }
4538 }
4539
4540 // Reset x start to left side of box
4541 xs = x0;
4542 // Scan bounding box from ys-1 up, calculate pixel intensity from distance to line
4543 for (int32_t yp = ys-1; yp >= y0; yp--) {
4544 bool swin = true; // Flag to start new window area
4545 bool endX = false; // Flag to skip pixels
4546 ypay = yp - ay;
4547 for (int32_t xp = xs; xp <= x1; xp++) {
4548 if (endX) if (alpha <= LoAlphaTheshold) break; // Skip right side of drawn line
4549 xpax = xp - ax;
4550 alpha = ar - wedgeLineDistance(xpax, ypay, bax, bay, rdt);
4551 if (alpha <= LoAlphaTheshold ) continue;
4552 // Track line boundary
4553 if (!endX) { endX = true; xs = xp; }
4554 if (alpha > HiAlphaTheshold) {
4555 #ifdef GC9A01_DRIVER
4556 drawPixel(xp, yp, fg_color);
4557 #else
4558 if (swin) { setWindow(xp, yp, x1, yp); swin = false; }
4559 pushColor(fg_color);
4560 #endif
4561 continue;
4562 }
4563 //Blend colour with background and plot
4564 if (bg_color == 0x00FFFFFF) {
4565 bg = readPixel(xp, yp); swin = true;
4566 }
4567 #ifdef GC9A01_DRIVER
4568 uint16_t pcol = fastBlend((uint8_t)(alpha * PixelAlphaGain), fg_color, bg);
4569 drawPixel(xp, yp, pcol);
4570 swin = swin;
4571 #else
4572 if (swin) { setWindow(xp, yp, x1, yp); swin = false; }
4573 pushColor(fastBlend((uint8_t)(alpha * PixelAlphaGain), fg_color, bg));
4574 #endif
4575 }
4576 }
4577
4578 inTransaction = lockTransaction;
4579 end_nin_write();
4580}
PixelAlphaGain
constexpr float PixelAlphaGain
Definition TFT_eSPI.cpp:3950
HiAlphaTheshold
constexpr float HiAlphaTheshold
Definition TFT_eSPI.cpp:3952
LoAlphaTheshold
constexpr float LoAlphaTheshold
Definition TFT_eSPI.cpp:3951
TFT_eSPI::pushColor
virtual void pushColor(uint16_t color)
Definition TFT_eSPI.cpp:3790
TFT_eSPI::clipWindow
bool clipWindow(int32_t *xs, int32_t *ys, int32_t *xe, int32_t *ye)
Definition TFT_eSPI.cpp:413
TFT_eSPI::begin_nin_write
virtual void begin_nin_write()
Definition TFT_eSPI.cpp:86
TFT_eSPI::end_nin_write
virtual void end_nin_write()

2810{

2812 inTransaction = true;
2813

2815

2817 for (i = 0; i < w; i++ ) {
2818 if (pgm_read_byte(bitmap + j * byteWidth + i / 8) & (1 << (i & 7))) {
2819 drawPixel(x + i, y + j, color);
2820 }
2821 }

inlinevirtual

116 {
117 if(!inTransaction) { // Flag to stop ending transaction during multiple graphics calls
118 if (!locked) { // Locked when beginTransaction has been called
119 locked = true; // Flag to show SPI access now locked
120 SPI_BUSY_CHECK; // Check send complete and clean out unused rx data

◆ fillCircle()

void TFT_eSPI::fillCircle ( int32_t x,
int32_t y,
int32_t r,
uint32_t color )

Definición en la línea 2414 del archivo TFT_eSPI.cpp.

2415{
2416 int32_t x = 0;
2417 int32_t dx = 1;
2418 int32_t dy = r+r;
2419 int32_t p = -(r>>1);
2420
2421 //begin_tft_write(); // Sprite class can use this function, avoiding begin_tft_write()
2422 inTransaction = true;
2423
2424 drawFastHLine(x0 - r, y0, dy+1, color);
2425
2426 while(x<r){
2427
2428 if(p>=0) {
2429 drawFastHLine(x0 - x, y0 + r, dx, color);
2430 drawFastHLine(x0 - x, y0 - r, dx, color);
2431 dy-=2;
2432 p-=dy;
2433 r--;
2434 }
2435
2436 dx+=2;
2437 p+=dx;
2438 x++;
2439
2440 drawFastHLine(x0 - r, y0 + x, dy+1, color);
2441 drawFastHLine(x0 - r, y0 - x, dy+1, color);
2442
2443 }
2444
2445 inTransaction = lockTransaction;
2446 end_tft_write(); // Does nothing if Sprite class uses this function
2447}

◆ fillCircleHelper()

void TFT_eSPI::fillCircleHelper ( int32_t x,
int32_t y,
int32_t r,
uint8_t cornername,
int32_t delta,
uint32_t color )

Definición en la línea 2454 del archivo TFT_eSPI.cpp.

2455{
2456 int32_t f = 1 - r;
2457 int32_t ddF_x = 1;
2458 int32_t ddF_y = -r - r;
2459 int32_t y = 0;
2460
2461 delta++;
2462
2463 while (y < r) {
2464 if (f >= 0) {
2465 if (cornername & 0x1) drawFastHLine(x0 - y, y0 + r, y + y + delta, color);
2466 if (cornername & 0x2) drawFastHLine(x0 - y, y0 - r, y + y + delta, color);
2467 r--;
2468 ddF_y += 2;
2469 f += ddF_y;
2470 }
2471
2472 y++;
2473 ddF_x += 2;
2474 f += ddF_x;
2475
2476 if (cornername & 0x1) drawFastHLine(x0 - r, y0 + y, r + r + delta, color);
2477 if (cornername & 0x2) drawFastHLine(x0 - r, y0 - y, r + r + delta, color);
2478 }
2479}

◆ fillEllipse()

void TFT_eSPI::fillEllipse ( int16_t x,
int16_t y,
int32_t rx,
int32_t ry,
uint16_t color )

Definición en la línea 2538 del archivo TFT_eSPI.cpp.

2539{
2540 if (rx<2) return;
2541 if (ry<2) return;
2542 int32_t x, y;
2543 int32_t rx2 = rx * rx;
2544 int32_t ry2 = ry * ry;
2545 int32_t fx2 = 4 * rx2;
2546 int32_t fy2 = 4 * ry2;
2547 int32_t s;
2548
2549 //begin_tft_write(); // Sprite class can use this function, avoiding begin_tft_write()
2550 inTransaction = true;
2551
2552 for (x = 0, y = ry, s = 2*ry2+rx2*(1-2*ry); ry2*x <= rx2*y; x++) {
2553 drawFastHLine(x0 - x, y0 - y, x + x + 1, color);
2554 drawFastHLine(x0 - x, y0 + y, x + x + 1, color);
2555
2556 if (s >= 0) {
2557 s += fx2 * (1 - y);
2558 y--;
2559 }
2560 s += ry2 * ((4 * x) + 6);
2561 }
2562
2563 for (x = rx, y = 0, s = 2*rx2+ry2*(1-2*rx); rx2*y <= ry2*x; y++) {
2564 drawFastHLine(x0 - x, y0 - y, x + x + 1, color);
2565 drawFastHLine(x0 - x, y0 + y, x + x + 1, color);
2566
2567 if (s >= 0) {
2568 s += fy2 * (1 - x);
2569 x--;
2570 }
2571 s += rx2 * ((4 * y) + 6);
2572 }
2573
2574 inTransaction = lockTransaction;
2575 end_tft_write(); // Does nothing if Sprite class uses this function
2576}

Hace referencia a drawFastHLine() y end_tft_write().

4660{
4661 if (_vpOoB) return;
4662
4663 x+= _xDatum;
4664 y+= _yDatum;
4665
4666 // Clipping
4667 if ((x >= _vpW) || (y >= _vpH)) return;
4668
4669 if (x < _vpX) { w += x - _vpX; x = _vpX; }
4670 if (y < _vpY) { h += y - _vpY; y = _vpY; }
4671
4672 if ((x + w) > _vpW) w = _vpW - x;
4673 if ((y + h) > _vpH) h = _vpH - y;
4674
4675 if ((w < 1) || (h < 1)) return;

4741
4742 x+= _xDatum;
4743 y+= _yDatum;
4744
4745 // Clipping
4746 if ((x >= _vpW) || (y >= _vpH)) return;
4747
4748 if (x < _vpX) { w += x - _vpX; x = _vpX; }
4749 if (y < _vpY) { h += y - _vpY; y = _vpY; }
4750

4752 if ((y + h) > _vpH) h = _vpH - y;
4753

4755

4757

4759 float alpha = 255.0;
4760 uint32_t color = color1;

4763 drawFastVLine(x++, y, h, color);
4764 alpha += delta;
4765 color = fastBlend((uint8_t)alpha, color1, color2);
4766 }
